text: I called in for a take-out order. The staff was super friendly.  They were completely accommodating as I continually adjusted my order. The food was completely off the charts delicious. Hands down the best Ahi Poke in the valley. The Furikake Chicken is absolutely amazing!  The portions are big and the flavors are wonderful. I will be back again and again

My family came to Island Flavor after hearing good reviews, and we were not disappointed! The poke (we got the Avo Poke) was the best I've ever had--and I'm a huge poke fan. The furikake chicken was delicious; it was crispy with tons of furikake flavor. The beef teriyaki was tender and perfectly cooked.
We also got the chicken katsu, kalua pork, shrimp, & the Korean chicken, which were all good but not as tasty as the other ones. 

The service was friendly & helpful. The inside was small & clean. We will definitely be back :)

Very good food for the price. Was please stay surprised to find this place just off the main road. Nice employees. We has the kalua and cabbage, kalbi and bento box. All were great. Kalbi was cut nice and thick. Seating is limited. Most that came in were pick up orders. Definitely a place to keep on my phone.

My first time having Furikake Chicken and I must say it was delicious.  The staff behind the counter were very friendly.  The guy who bagged my food forgot my mac salad but when I went back to ask, he apologized and gave me a second one for the inconvenience.  The amount of food you get for the price is great so be very hungry or ready to share.
Great portions awesome food born and raised in Hawaii lot's of local grind spots In Vegas. This place is the best!!
Great Hawaiian food for Las Vegas. Prices are a bit high for plate lunch but the portions are hefty. I definitely recommend this place!

I come to that place at least two time ms a week. 
Portions are huge and service is great!
All their specials are amazing and the mixed plate (Chicken Furikake and Burger Steak) is just bomb and so much food!
Hope this place continuous doing in the exactly same way for a long time!

Now im loving hawaiian cuisine! This is beyond expectation. I love how cozy their restaurant is. The place is neat and service staff are great! The food ofcourse is delicious than ever! I know theres GOOD FOOD somewhere hidden and i found it!

Great Big Island food.  I like the kali short ribs.  My kids love the Kalua pig with cabbage.  Great Hawaiian Loco moka.  Excellent service.  Call for take out. I lived in Kona for 12 years a d it is the best local food I have found.

This place is awsome they make the best furikaki chicken! I always get the furikaki and korean short ribs combo. It's a bit pricey but worth it. They give you a big container filled with rice, chicken and short ribs for $15 bucks. It'll be 5 stars if only the ribs tasted better. It's hit or miss but even that the ribs could be better it's on the salty side.

The ambiance of Island Flavor Express was about what you can expect from an establishment with the word "Express" in it. The casual Hawaiian restaurant is a quiet hole-in-the-wall in a strip mall off the 215 and Eastern Ave. As soon as you walk in the door, you are engulfed in the distinct scent of steamed rice, grilling meat, and soy. The dining area, which is quite small, as they do mostly to-go and catering orders, is not much to look at. The tables, chairs, and flooring all look dilapidated and in need of repair or replacement, though everything is clean and organized. The environment is overall welcoming, as the manager personally greets each customer and seemed to immediately know when it was someone's first time (a sure sign of a loyal customer-base!). 

Despite its humble appearance, the food was fantastic! The restaurant, both the dining and cooking areas, appeared clean. Though the kitchen was open to the dining area, there was not too much kitchen noise that it disrupted conversation. Besides the great food, the aroma is the next best thing I remember after walking in - the perfect combination of sweet and salty married with delicious grilled meats. I was also astonished at the portion that is served in one of their platters, which costs just $9. Not only does the meat of your choice come with two sides, but it comes with enough meat to easily feed two to three people. It was a fantastic value!

Not only was the food excellent, but the service was decent as well. Both the service staff and the kitchen staff had good attitudes and greeted people as they entered. The manager, who was serving as well, was very warm and attentive. The service was both authentic and efficient, and the staff all appeared tidy and well-groomed. The restaurant did seem well-staffed, as there was little wait time, though it was not very busy when I was there, and with increased volume, additional servers may be a good idea to keep up with their service standards.  Overall, I was very pleased with the food & service I experienced here.
One of our new favorite spots. Furikake chicken is amazing along with the short ribs. Musubi is a must also.

Our family is overjoyed that Island Flavor will be a little closer to where we live. This is our go to place when we're craving comfort food from home. This drive in style location is great for take out convenience. Wishing Bruce and the gang all the best!!!

Super Bowl Sunday... Last customer of the day. They closed early because it was slow. I ordered Furikake SHRIMP to go (obviously because they was closing). Got home.. Opened plate.. Got Furikake CHICKEN!! Omg! Still love this place but the cook needs to read the ticket carefully! I really was craving for SHRIMP not chicken. I even got the chili sauce for the Shrimp

When you've been away from home for too long, or really just need a good hearty meal. Food is plentiful and onolicious. Service is with aloha, and prices are really good. Specials are what's up. My boyfriend and
I vacationed in Vegas. We both miss home so much. It was comfort food times a million! Can't wait to go back!

Best place to go! Especially if your looking for local Hawaiian food that taste just like being in home in Hawaii! Nicole is the best!!!! she always give great customer service and the food is so ONO!
So so good. I loved the furikake chicken and ribs. I can't wait to go back for more. The service was great also.
Great service,Huge portions and cheap ! Definitely one Hawaii style plate lunch restaurant !

As I knew this place by Yelp and it seems to be high reputation, I've got to try some furikake chicken, Kalbi beef, and poke ahi tuna. To be honest, the food didn't taste that great to me. Kalbi was dried and hard to bite and I wanted to point out that the Poke tuna wasn't fresh and even didn't taste enough as the sauce was too
light.
new favorite local spot. Always fresh and everything on the menus is authentic and delicious. Nice little eating area inside. Reminds me of the islands.

For the taste, quality, and quantity of the food, Island flavor should be in some high traffic location with big signs and a line out the door ALWAYS. Lucky for me, it is right next door to my community, and in a quiet lot, (so the line isn't THAT long whenever I come in). It's one of the Vegas' Hawaiian community's best kept secrets! I crave this place once a week at LEAST. It's fresh, delicious, and worth every penny.

This place is excellent. The staff is so friendly and welcoming. The food is just as delicious as their original location. The kalbi ribs are the best. I used to be willing to drive all the way to their original location which was on the other side of town, but now I won't have to and I'm so excited about that. I'll definitely be coming back.

This is my new go-to when I am in town for business.  Being from Hawaii and living in Houston, coming to the Vegas area serves one purpose for me: Hawaiian grinds.  A lot of Hawaiian places do not take AmEx, which is fine but I would rather use my company card when on the road.  It's not a deal maker or breaker for me, but it instantly gives them at least half a star for my purposes.

The food is so ono!  Last night I ordered the mixed plate with katsu and kalbi.  The mac salad is legit.  The chicken katsu was moist, which is rare for a thin cut like that.  The kalbi was delicious!  The rice was perfectly cooked.  It's the best Hawaiian food I've had since leaving Pearl City.

The decor is nothing fancy... as it should be.  The Jawaiian music is playing.  The people are nice and take the time to learn the names of their customers.  This place just feels like home.

I am going back for lunch today since I have to leave tomorrow.  This place will definitely be on my "must eat at" list whenever I am in town.  Mahalo!!

Glad to have Island Flavor Express in Henderson! Daily Specials on Point. Mix Plate gotta have choice of Two Items - sweet & savory/salty & sweet items to choose from. Big Portions. Tasty. Don't forget to save room for Desserts! Yummay! Can't forget the Staff - very Friendly & helpful - Thanks Nicole!
Furikake chicken -it was nice and crispy but I wanted it to have just a little bit more flavor. It was, however, a huge portion.

Really sad, but not as good as they use to be. Something is not right and losing consistent following. Not sure if kitchen staff changed or price cuts happened for food which entails lower quality. Hope this gets fixed I use to love this place.
My favorite Hawaiian joint - hands down! Delicious food - large portions. It's so so good!

One of my faves for local food when I'm missing home.. Usually always pretty busy but definitely worth the wait, or you can always call in your order if you're doing takeout.. Keep up the awesome work guys!!
This is definitely a fav to my top goto quick Hawaiian grubs. Everything is fresh cooked made to order and everyone is so nice here.

Food always good and staff always friendly. We come for lunch and dinner and always leave happy.  Come hungry.. Poke plate is my usual but when the lau lau is the daily special that's the hot pick. Kim Chi fried rice and Korean chicken is Ono. Too much to name..

This is place is for real. The best plate lunch place and I'm a local from the islands.  The hamburger steak is awesome and almost as good as Dots. But you need to try the furikaki shrimp, and Kalbi with fried rice as this combo is off the hook. I wish they would open up a location in California but I make sure I stop by every time I'm in Vegas for some good grind.
I ordered the bento box with eggs, spam, teriyaki beef, chicken and rice. It was very good. Good service and the location was easy to find.

Beyond delicious food, I was just disappointed when they forgot part of our order. They made up for it by giving us free dessert though (Cocoa Puffs) which were PHENOMENAL. Also, their spam musubis were fresh and authentic. Love this place.
I got a loco moco the patty was hard this place is not the same from wen they first open

I ordered the mixed plate with furikake chicken n kalbi.
Portion was huge n taste was soooo good.
Chicken was krispy n Kalbi was chacol taste.
Food was little bit salty itself but it was perfect with rice. Chili viniger on each table was very good as a dipping sauce. 
Cashier was super nice as well. She even brought the food to my table. 

I will definitely go back n try something else.

The food is excellent. Can't compare it to the island, as I have never been there. Tastes great though. The Kalua pork with cabbage had great flavor and was not dried out. Rice was good too. Add in the cold macaron it salad and it is even better. Only bad thing from my perspective was that my table was dirty. Couldn't see anything else wrong with this. Great food and a nice crew.
The people that work here are super friendly. The furikake chicken here is the best. It's my go to for sure

Of course...the food was AMAZING. Large portions of traditional yet unique foods. We've tried their spicy ahi avocado poke, furikake chicken, pork roast, and pork dumplings. I have NO complaints.  The ahi was cut in good sized cubes and was so firm and fresh. The furikake chicken is the perfect sweet and salty and crunchy combo. The pork roast was perfection. 
Not to mention the service was great. It seemed like all waitresses checked on all tables whether they were in their zones or not. Lots of Aloha in this place. Keep it up guys!

Craving Hawaiian food? This is your spot! I've gone here a few times now and every time it's been legit. I'm not Hawaiian so I can't really touch on authenticity, but flavor, they don't disappoint! 

Things we've had:

Adobo 
Kimchi fried rice 
Furakaki chicken 
Mochiko chicken
Loco moco
Beef stew
Korean chicken

All 5 stars!!

I'd have photos, but let's be real I killed that shit before I could take a photo.
Great flavor at a great price. Both locations serve great food and have great service.  I always go for the specials like oxtail soup. A place you can't beat for Hawaiian food.
Terrific, authentic Hawaiian food right across from the movie theater. Very nice staff.

Straight Dynamite! Great food, very affordable, good service, fantastic cooks. Pig and cabbage is the best I've ever had. Mushibos to go are big and delicious and $2. Hot bento boxes for super fast takeout. Chili water on the tables! Since I found it I eat here once to twice a week.

We normally go to the Island Flavor on Durango. Wanted to try this one out. 

Please take this as constructive criticism, and not a negative comment.

I ordered the Teri Beef with Stir fry, it was very tasty but the stir fry really didn't have much vegetables. Maybe putting a little more onions, some bell peppers and some mushrooms would bring it up to another level.

My wife got the Shrimp Scampi. We were not aware that it was shrimp with rice. we were expecting shrimp with pasta. Suggest letting customers know it doesn't come with pasta. Also the taste really wasn't there. I couldn't put my finger on on what was missing. but as a suggestion, maybe a little more garlic/butter and maybe with some olive oil and not cook as long as the shrimp was really overcooked.

We would like to come back and support local businesses from the 808 as that's where we moved here from.

Again, please take this comment as a positive way to possibly improve rather than a negative comment/complaint.

This is my favorite "local Hawaiian" food restaurant.  Huge portions that tastes great.  I usually get their sweet and sour spare ribs and the chicken long rice specials when they have them but everything's good there.  If you like "broke the mouth taste and fill the opu portions" this is the place to go.

i usually visit the restaurant on the other side of LV. but overall, everything was a bit off on the last visit. i wrote my review and someone from island flavor wrote back apologizing and asking me to come back as they had fixed some of the items i had mentioned!  that's a winning management--responsive.  i'll be happy to come back--really, how can i stay away?  :)  ok, now for the original review:

teri beef:  a solid bit too salty. and even though cut properly (against the grain), still tough.
macaroni salad: sadly, it was served super cold! couldn't taste it.  i think they need to turn that fridge down a few degrees! then again, if you're doing take out, that thing is the perfect temperature by the time you get home.
poke--was ok this visit. got the hawaii one with limu.

friendly service, lots of local people hanging out. i wish they could have someone bring them a BIB of the real strawberry flavored fruit punch from the islands instead of the tropicana version. i like the fanta syrup, but it's easy to get the big box at restaurant supply places--they're even near the airport. :)  i'd be happy to volunteer to bring you guys a box next time i have to bring checked luggage anyway. or maybe LV coke distributor can nab some for you guys. :)
Was told about this place from some co-workers and what can i say.... This place is awesome!! So good, Im definitely coming back.
It's nice to have some real local food. We always call in our order. They're on top of things here. It's always ready and fresh.

First off we love coming here, but today....the crew they had really SUCKED!!!!!! It took 25mins to get 1 mixed plate, also we had ordered a musubi and was told they don't have any. Once I received my plate I could see the girl making the musubi's had 6 full rolls that she had just sitting on the cutting board. The staff today wasnt on top of things. Especially the girl making the Musubi's seemed like she didn't want to be here working just dragging her feet. Unbelievable that today this place ain't got it together...... Should've gone to the Durango location. Next time I'll watch what staff is working.

Smaller venue but the food is just as delicious from their other location on Durango! My favorite is the furikake chicken. Huge serving of boneless fried chicken pieces marinated in a sweet sauce and sprinkled with furikake! I definitely recommend this place to anyone that loves Hawaiian food!
Amazingly delicious food.  Furikake chicken is a must!  Roast pork loco moco is yummy!

Can't get enough of this spot... Awesome friendly staff, and amazing food. Theres nothing more you can ask for. My staple is the Furikaki Chicken... juicy on the inside, crispy on the outside, and the sweet and savory notes from the coated sauce just pops. The teriyaki beef is also another great choice. My only con is that the place is very small; 4-5 tables max... considering its always packed when I go... I always order "to-go"
Food is amazing and the customer service is even better!  You can never go wrong here.  The furikake chicken and kalbi ribs ate perfect everytime!
My favorite Hawaiian BBQ! Mac salad is amazing and the furikake chicken is to die for!! The teriyaki beef is so tender always!! Mix plates are enough for two!
The BEST Hawaiian food in Henderson. I've been here several times now, and will continue coming back!

I haven't written a review in awhile...but, I felt obligated after trying Island Flavor for the first time. Located right off the 215 and Eastern in the Regal Plaza, right next to the PT's (the old Roadrunner bar, for those who remember that place). I had heard good things about this Hawaiian (excuse me, big island) style plate lunch spot. I had the day off, so I thought I would give it go...

First off, very small place, maybe 5 bistro style table seating to one side and the kitchen on the other side. Love the Hawaiian/Reggae music selection playing ( does anyone still call it Jahwaiian?). Decor is what you would expect, pictures of Hawaiian flowers and foliage and a representation of all the islands on the wall...but, hey, not here for decor, here for the foods.

They have a small specialized menu and daily specials board (all sounded good to me...), but I opted for the mix plate w/ the Furikake Chicken everyone's raving about and Roast Pork with gravy ($11.25). Ordered to go...when the chef called my name and handed me my plate lunch bagged up, he gave me one of those "what's up bruddah" chin nods. Like he knew what deliciousness I was in store for. I grabbed for my bag of food, and I swear the thing weighed like at least 5 lbs.! He noticed the surprised look on my face and smiled, I mustered a "thanks bruddah" and headed home.

In anticipation, I popped open my styrofoam container and...boom! Huge, I mean, HUGE portion of the chicken ( I think I might've actually gasped). For the unbelievers, see photo... Now I know what all the hype was about, the Furikake Chicken was super ono. Crunchy fried chicken nuggets of love, rolled in a honey sweet sauce and salty seaweed,bonito flakes with sesame seeds...sweet and savory, how I likes it. If I had to reminisce, I would say it kinda reminded me of the "Tasty" Chicken they serve at the Alley in the Aiea Bowl in Hawaii ( if you're from Aiea, you know what I'm talking about). The Roast Pork was tender and juicy, it just fell apart as I dug into it. Good gravy! The gravy was good...and the Mac salad was legit. I think there was an audible "oh my god this is good!" As I was nom-nomming away.

So, yeah...that happened. So delicious, but couldn't finish it...leftovers, yay! Island Flavor, thumbs up and shakas!!! will definitely be back, maybe give it the fifth star

Ordered Kalua without cabbage and they accidentally cooked it with. I told them I didn't mind, and cashier told me if I didn't like it they'd recook it. I ate it anyway and in the middle of my meal she brought me kalua without cabbage for free! Great food and excellent customer service!
Tried the furikake chicken and damn!!!!   i cant say anything else other than its amazing.!

I finally got to try this place out! I had to order food to pick-up before work, but I still got to try it!
So yeah... I ordered through eat24 for pick-up. Requested the Mixed Plate Combo with Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Short Ribs. I didn't know that it already came with a side of Mac Salad, so I ordered another one. No biggie! I'll just save that for tonight's dinner XD
Anyway... I was seriously liking the flavors of the food once I had the time to chow down!
Customer service was awesome too, and I only stayed for like 5 minutes at the most. The nice cashier greeted me once I got in, and figured it was my to-go order, which she was right about. I think it was all about the demeanor, and I miss hearing the friendly Hawaiian pigeon accent. 
The bonus point for me is that the place is near home! Score!

I usually stop in for spam musubi because I like that they are ready and I don't have to call in an order. Today I went early enough that they had boxes available to purchase, so I tried one. The rice, spam and teriyaki chicken were good but the rest wasn't great. The beef was fatty and the eggs didn't have much flavor. 

The photo I posted shows the little spot where they have pre made items for sale. The boxes sell out by early afternoon and the spam musubi is usually there until late afternoon, from my experience. All of the boxes there today were the one shown in my picture, so that might be the normal options. 

As far as their spam musubi, I really like it because they put sauce on either side of the spam. They come with a lot of rice too.
This place is so good!!! Huge delicious portions at reasonable prices.  Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas.

I ate here for the first time tonight and I'm so happy I did! Island Grill (also on Eastern) is usually my go-to place for my Hawaiian food fix but I wanted to change things up and try something new. 

I ordered their furikake chicken and a Hawaiian sun juice. I got a generous amount of chicken with two scoops of white rice (you can sub it for fried rice for $2 more) and mac salad. It kind of reminded me of Zippy's Korean chicken, which made me instantly nostalgic. The mac salad was really tasty and they give generous scoops of rice, which is great if you're serious about that meat to rice ratio, like I am!
This is a nice place to eat off of the strip for some very good chicken and short ribs, very friendly staff. I will definitely be back again soon.

One of the top 3 loco mocos I've eaten and this includes the restaurants in Hawaii. We ordered the regular moco loco and the Kahlua pig moco loco and both were well seasoned and tender.  Gigantic portions too! Can't wait to try their plate lunches and salads.....

This place is amazing! Very nice vibe of Hawaii. Almost feels like a local restaurant back in the island. Staff was great and welcoming and the furikake chicken is a must try! One thing I want to definitely point out is the Kalbi Short ribs. If you're use to going to L&L, Aloha Kitchen, or #1 Hawaiian Barbecue, you're use to getting it for about 8 bucks. You'll notice here at Island Flavor that it's double, but man oh man when you get that Kalbi on your table and you open it up, you'll notice the difference. Very thick and just tender enough where you can easily bite and break it down as you chew. Juicy and the marinade they use just tastes so good. This is one of those occasions where paying more for Kalbi here compared to other spots that charge cheaper, is worth every dollar!

On my last foray to Las Vegas, I was mindful I had review number 200 waiting to be written, and I wanted number 200 to be something sexy. After making my way through every nook and cranny of the strip and beyond, I found myself sitting at a tall table in Island Flavor and greatly anticipating my lunch. 

We ordered Chicken Katsu and Teriyaki Chicken plates with the requisite sides of white rice (which comes in two scoops) and macaroni salad. When the food arrived (with a broad smile from the cashier/server/greeter), I was impressed with the size of the meal. As is typical of Hawaiian food, there always seems to be too much for an average sized person to consume. Since I was lodged in a hotel, I was forced (not really) to man-up and eat it all. 

My Teriyaki Chicken had three generous slabs of tender chicken (with a nice outer sear), which were well marinaded and seasoned. I think there was also a hint of smoke on the meat, which was a nice touch. The mac and rice were standard. The Chicken Katsu had a nice exterior crunch. Put it all together, at a value price and served in an unpretentious atmosphere, and you have an ALOHA BOMB of a meal. 

Unfortunately, as hard as I tried to look for a back story to go along with this review, I struck out. Nothing colorful and nothing sexy to add "Flavor" to this review, but since Island Flavor is more about the food than anything else, the lack of fluff seems ever so appropriate. 

FOR THE RECORD

I will go on record by saying my meal at Island Flavor was more pleasing to me than any other meal I had in Las Vegas on this trip (and that includes spending over a couple of C-notes for a fancy steak dinner). 

If you're in the area and you have a hankering for a good hearty Hawaiian meal, stop by Island Flavor and check them out. Aloha!

I would say my favorite Hawaiian restaurant at the moment!

I've been to the Island Flavor out in Durango a few years ago and I liked it then. I've obviously forgotten how good it was, but now very glad that they've opened this one on Eastern!

Kind of dangerous that it's near by LVAC (gym we go to) because it's an easy "postworkout" place!

Things we ordered :
Loco Moco - Juicy, thick, beef patty over rice, topped with eggs (cooked in your way), drizzled with brown gravy!

Furikake Chicken - The Hawaiian version of orange chicken? Chunky, chicken chunks, fried then tossed in this salty sweet sauce! SO GOOD!

Yakisoba with Teri Chicken - Pan friend noodles with veggies, BBQ pork, eggs, onions, and of course grilled teriyaki chicken! Great comfort food!

Their Mac Salad is also amazing, comes with most of the plates!

BIG PORTIONS, might be a good a idea to share plates!

Island Flavor definitely has that authentic taste in their dishes, service is fast and staff are nice and attentive!

A minus in my part would be the tall tables and one regular table. I'm 4'9'' so it was a little difficult going back and forth from the drink machine to table, also making sure my little one didn't move to much so he wouldn't fall (not kid friendly)!

Other than that, definitely a favorite!

Best "Real" Hawaiian Food in Las Vegas! Quality food & quality people. I highly recommend trying 
You won't want the other spots!

This was such a surprise. I'm usually skeptical over places in strip malls but this was some of the best food I've had in a while. I tried out the mix Kalbi short ribs and this fried chicken(it comes with this sauce that starts with a "f"). Food was off the hook. The portions are overly generous. Had enough for two meals. Definitely gonna take that hike out there again soon. Delicious. Also, most importantly, not pricy at all.

Updated review : I absolutely love this place but lately I can't even seem to call in an order , this has been going on for months now.. You call and call and call.. It will either ring for 5 minutes and go to some weird answering machine or you will get a busy signal "user busy" this happened 2 days ago. I'm driving home from work, decide to stop at the gas station and make a call to island flavor so I could pick up my order and it would be ready by the time I got there.. After 10 minutes of failed call attempts.. I walk into the restaurant and only one customer inside.. Not SO busy they couldn't answer the phone. 


Literally the best Hawaiian food in vegas. I always get the Teri beef, my gf gets the kalbi ribs. They use the most quality meat I've ever tasted at any Hawaiian BBQ place. The Teri beef plate is like a giant steak cut up into thick cutlets. It's enough for 2 meals. One now and one later :D

The macaroni salad is probably my favorite part, it's ridiculously flavorful. I recommend island flavor to every single one of my friends and every tourist I meet that loves Hawaiian food. My tip to anyone ordering : call in your order to save some time waiting for food.

My gf and I were in the area and we were super hangry and saw that there was a Hawaiian place nearby with good reviews so we decided to check it out. The lady that took our order was super nice and friendly and helpful. The place was nice and clean and comfortable with nice Hawaiian music playing. And the food. OMG the food. I got the furikake chicken and kalbi combo and let me tell you, my container was filled to the brim with food. And ah it was so so good. Kalbi ribs were nice and thick and juicy and meaty and tasted amazing (unlike some places, ahem, a place that rhymes with "a mocha thicken" comes to mind, that serve super thin kalbi ribs that are 80% fat). Furikake chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside and super flavorful. I couldn't stop eating even though I was already full, AND I still have a ton of leftovers. LOVE this place. Can't wait to come back!

Big flavor. Big portions. Head to Island Flavor Express!

People who lived in Hawaii are blessed that Vegas is the 9th island. You don't have to go far to get some Island grinds. The newest addition to Henderson is located in the shopping area on Eastern Ave & Pebble. 

Same owners as Island Flavor on Durango, they are a casual place-order/pick-up order or take-out service style restaurant. The staff has been incredibly friendly on each visit and the place is clean and simple, with about 6 tables inside. 

Food I've ordered:

Furikake Ahi Poke
Hawaiian-Style Poke
Kalbi Ribs
Furikake Chicken & Shrimp

Furikake Chicken - Let's cut to the chase. I don't even eat chicken. The batter and glaze they use is insane, I couldn't help but try a few pieces that were just crumb batter. OMG. Sweet and salty deliciousness! My boyfriend and toddler loved it, too. I tried the shrimp version, and they over-fried it, so I wasn't as happy with it. 

Poke - The portion they give are great. The fish is cubed into good sizes. However, I can't say it's the best I've had. The fish tastes good, but I prefer the poke to have been marinated longer. Melt-in-your-mouth kind of poke...

Kalbi - Ridiculous portion and the meat is tender! Look at the posted pictures below.

Desserts - They have a rotating selection found in the fridge by the door, so you can self-serve and take it to the counter. I have yet to try any, but I've seen Chantilly, Haupia, Guava Chiffon, and Coco Puffs. They also stock Hawaiian Sun canned drinks.

Look at their chalkboard for their daily specials. They serve Lau Lau on Fridays and I've seen Mahi Mahi and Kalua Pig posted, too.

This has become one of those regular stops I'll make when I want some quick but tasty Hawaiian eats for the family. I'd love it if they could start serving oxtail soup and malasadas! That's the only thing I can say they are missing. But I'd highly recommend stopping by if you're hungry in Hendertucky!

Hmm I don't know...somethin not right here...The Kalbi plate I usually pick up for my family is still sitting in the fridge..."Tastes like beef jerky" said B Jr. That's the 2nd time in the past couple months that we didn't care for it. Last time 1/2 my order was burnt it was a to-go order so I didn't realize it til we got home. Mr B. still thinks their Pot Roast Loco Moco is bomb though! 

Haven't seen any of the regular staff either.
No "Howzit Auntie " cause  the cooks that are there the times we went spoke Spanish only. Everyone is nice, but other than the island music, some ofthat Aloha vibe is missing. 

So this time I ordered something else, Oxtail Soup.... sigh... broth was not like it used to be either and Oxtail was real tough ...what's up with that? So Mr B will have to find someone else get his Loco Moco, cause I can't bring myself to come here for awhile.

Visiting from SoCal. I absolutely love the Furikake chicken. It has great savory flavor. The amount of chicken I got was on point. Also, their poke is delicious! The staff was very friendly and made this an enjoyable experience.
How funny that someone stated too much breading on Korean short ribs???? Kalbi isn't breaded. Lol.

First time here. I had a craving for Loco Moco and was not disappointed. Came early lunch and it was packed. Loco Moco had a 10 oz patty, enough for two. Rice was a little over cooked but the flavors made up for it. My wife had Kalbi Short Ribs with brown rice. Also delicious and tender. Huge portions easy to split. Service is friendly and for sure will make this a regular since it is very close to us. I doubt you would be disappointed.

NOM NOM NOM! This place is great! I stick to the furikake chicken because it's just THAT good, but I've had a few other things that were tasty too. The furikake is just my go to here. I've never been let down by it. Aside from the perfectly crisp furikake covered chicken, is their holy grail... que the drum roll... the mac salad. -Insert moment of silence here- YES! it is that good! It's amazing! I can't even begin to explain. I could literally eat a tub of this with no regrets. The food is just really good, freshly made, and super yummy! The staff is always super nice, and speedy! I wish there was one closer to my house.. I'd probably ask them for a job and accept furikake chicken as payment. No joke. Getchu' some!

Ordered the special of the day the Pork Adobo and it was delicious and came with a large salad per my request for $9! We also ordered their shoyu poke to try it out. It was very good, the tuna chunks were large and pink. I have a favorite poke spot in Vegas already but Island Flavor didn't disappoint! Definitely stop by if you're looking for local food.

Come for the furikake chicken, fresh-made poke, and daily specials- and someone call me when the huli huli chicken comes back! This spot is quick and friendly,  but unfortunately I'm not around more because the consistency is lacking.  I also don't care for how they serve everything in styrofoam, which is terrible for the environment. 

I had one amazing order of the furikake chicken, and came back months later to a version that was overly thick with dry meat inside. The poke hasn't steered me wrong but it's not my top choice to get it. The musubi has been disappointing as well, but their mac salad is one of my favorites. Seems to be kind of hit or miss depending on the day. Props for allowing some substitutions!

Fantastic food!! My husband and I shared the mixed plate and still had some to take home. Very friendly staff! Smells delicious as soon as you get out of your car to head inside. Thank you Island Flavor!!

Small shop with some huge portions and tatse. The furikake chicken is definitely their signature item. Bite sized pieces of fried chicken, lightly glazed with a sweet sauce, and then topped with a seaweed and sesame seasoning. Definitely worth checking out and is becomming, if not already one of my favorite hawaiian spots.
I haven't been here in months and forgot how damn good it is. I've tried other Hawaiian food restaurants and this one is the best!
miss Hawaiian food done right thank you for the experience. Keep doing what your doing.
Garlic Miso Ahi side mac salad and some Limu Ahi Poke. WINNAHz Mahalo Bruce and the outstanding Island Flavor Express staff. #hi2sin #yoliapproved

Great food with big portions. Was very impressed with their shoyu poke & smoked meat w/ onions plate. Oh & finally found a place that also serves saimin--which tastes like back home! I wish I had found this place sooner!

brahhhh! Portions is always huge and prices are hard to beat for the amount and quality of food you get. Personal favorite is the roast pork loco moco or the chicken cutlet. MEAN da grindz over here. Little small on the inside but it is the express 1 so dont try to take a huge group here to sit and eat, you better hit up the other location for that kind of seating.

The best (and only) poke place I've seen outside of Hawaii (granted, I live in MissourI). I was a little skeptical at first and the wait for our food at noon was loooooong (which is my reason for the 4 stars, not 5), but we loved everything about our meal. We got an order of poke, one order of fried poke, and a order of the Kahlua pork. All of it was incredible. I'd tell you what flavors of each we got, but we let the cashier pick whatever she recommended, so I can't remember). Poke was fresh, tasty, and plentiful in each of our half orders and the kahlua pork looked unseasoned, but the taste was perfection. They need to expand asap, but definitely worth your time (even like us, driving from the strip).
Furikake Chicken is addictive! Love the place! Clean, good vibes, fast service, can order through yelp!

Great place near work. I placed an order for take out and Yelp notified me the food would be ready at 1:15pm. I got there at exactly 1:15pm and sure enough, food was ready! My food of choice was the mix plate with kalbi and furikake chicken. It comes with 2 scoops of rice and a side of mac salad so it's plenty of food! Everything was so tasty and I think I'm in love with the furikake chicken. Seriously order this if you're visiting this place! Will definitely keep this on my lunch list for work.

I've dined at my fair share of Hawaiian "BBQ" style restaurants and this one is definitely in the upper rankings! 

The hallmark of Hawaiian BBQ is the macaroni salad- theirs is beyond reproach. Chicken katsu and chicken teriyaki combo plate was exactly what it should be as well. Portions are big as well, so make sure you have an appetite! 

The menu is reasonably priced and service was friendly and quick, definitely a good option for lunch. I'll be back for sure:)

By far the best island food I have had since being in HI... also this take out location is way better than their sit down one. Not sure why but it is. The staff here is much better as well. 

I recommend the Furikake ckn or hamburger steak. Their best 2 dishes.

Took a chance and got the loco moco.... I'm SOOOO glad I did!  They also give you a lot - I was only able to eat half of the plate & half of a musubi. 

I will definitely come back - they are also very nice & welcoming too!

I eat here at least once a week because i work down the street but the food is always delicious, fair price and the service is awesome! They make you feel like ohana. Got my coworkers addicted to the masubi's

Best Hawaiian local food in Vegas! Isaiah is friendly with great customer service. Chef Steven cooked the furikake chicken and kalibi efficiently and it was onolicious. I would recommend this place to everyone!
Very good Island food. Huge portions. Chicken and steak are tender and juicy. Teriyaki sauce is perfection. Macaroni salad is tasty and fresh. Way better than L&L Bbq.
Love kalbi here. My fav is a mix plate of kalbi and Furukawa chicken and loco moco for kids. Oh I can eat here everyday!!!!

Food is amazing like always! Service on the other hand? Our server was extremely rude. Made no eye contact and whenever we asked for anything she would just say "yeah okay". As if it was too much to ask for more water. If they can just be nicer this place would get a higher star
We had a great breakfast today!!  Food was delicious and the service was awesome. MOCO LOCO was authentic like I had recently in Hawaii.  Yummmmmmm
Went to this spot with my cousin who is a local.  Highly recommend this place! Portions were huge and the food was excellent! Well worth the money.
Honestly the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. No questions asked. Five stars! Short ribs super juicy and full of flavor. The chicken they have here is waaaaaay too good. I can eat here every day!

This is actually Island Flavor Express, and it is just as good as its big brother Island Flavor on Durango. My husband and I were so exited to see their menu and try it out (we are huge fans of the other location) we grabbed an order of furikake chicken to take home on our way back from lunch. That is how good it is. The furikake chicken was done perfectly, crunchy on the outside, moist and flavorful on the inside, lots of good sauce. The mac salad was awesome too. Nice and creamy with just the perfect amount of dressing. We will be back to get all of our favorites, fried poke salad, loco moco, fried rice omelet. I may have to pick up jogging as a hobby now that this wonderful food is much closer to our home.
Fantastic food came into town for the weekend and had to stop by. Beef teriyaki steak is to die for.

So, I get off work around 8:30 and love Hawaiian food afterwards and this place pop up to close at 9pm.
I called and ordered and the person on the phone  told me the order will be ready and be reminded that they close at 9. When I got there 8:57 I expected my order to still be there since they said they close at 9pm. I see people are still eating inside when I get there so I knocked since the doors are locked up. The workers were just looking at me and wouldn't open the door, so then a guy finally came out at 9:02 and said all the orders were thrown out at 8:57. I was hoping for a decent notification when I called that the food will be thrown out at a certain time so I didn't have to drive there and wasted my time. Not coming here or will recommend this particular location to anyone due to this experience. 

Thank you anyways and good luck.

I've never had Furikake Chicken and it was amazing! One yelper mentioned it was like "The Hawaiian version of orange chicken" and that's what it is minus the orange flavor. The best part is that it's made fresh so it is extremely crunchy and did not have a soggy breading texture like panda express. The macaroni salad is delicious and not as tangy as L&L. I wish their portions for the macaroni salad was bigger!

The short ribs were delicious, flavorful and had great char marks.

Also had the guava cake, the cake itself and the guava jam is really good. Not overly sweet and the guava flavor is noticeable. I just was not a fan of the cool whip frosting. I love real whipped cream. Will probably stick with the Furikake Chicken only, for next time!

Service was great!

We love this place. The food is always fresh and food is out quickly. The portions are huge (my poke in the picture is a 1/2 order) they have call in for pickup, or you can order and wait and get it to go like we usually do. Tonight we are at the restaurant for the first time. It's got cool Hawaiian music playing and smells yummy.
I love the original island flavor but having this one on the east side is definitely worth it. Try their katsu it's Ono!!

First time dinning here. I was on the south side of town and had a craving for some Hawaiian food. This location had the highest rating in the area. 
I was glad I stopped in. It was around 1pm so I was hoping lunch rush had died down. My wife and I both ordered the Mixed plate with Katsu chicken/Kalbi it comes with 2 scoops of rice and a side of Mac salad. There portions were huge we couldn't eat all of it. 
We will be hitting this place again. 

The only down side is there was only like 5 tables. So there was people standing waiting on a table. And there's nothing like people staring at you like a hawk wondering if your getting up to leave or just get a refill on your drink. If it wasn't for this they would get a 5 * rating.

There are so many Hawaiian restaurants in town, but this is hands down the best place. I've tried a handful of items on their menu, but I always go back to the furikake chicken and kalbi short ribs. Seriously so much flavor. It may seem a little pricey, but the portions are huge! Definitely enough for 2 meals, and they make for good left overs.
Authentic. Had the saimin and fried rice omelet. Both broke da mout and made me feel like I was back home on the islands. Good people and good grindz. Definitely going back

We dropped by a Wednesday night for dinner. The restaurant was clean, nicely decorated and felt comfortable. There aren't that many tables, but we were able to grab the last available one.

We had a Hawaiian-style poke, spam, teriyaki chicken and beef, and egg bento box and a yakisoba with teriyaki chicken. Everything tasted delicious and were great values for the money.

We'll definitely be back to try some of their other dishes!

I've eaten at their Durango location and the food was great cooked perfectly. Today the food I ordered was burnt. The kalbi I ordered was perfectly cooked on one side the side that was facing up on the other side it was completely burnt. Even the teri steak was burnt and tastes bitter. Shame they would pass this off as edible.

I've been to Island Flavor a few times now, and I've finally remembered to write a review. It's a small location with 4-5 tables, but you're there for the food, right? 

Food is made to order there. It's fresh, you can watch them make your food. Portions are big and Service is always friendly. 

I'll go back!!!

Another solid local 808 food in Vegas. I have been to the other location on Durango. Not much difference in the food for the most part pretty consistent BIG portions and solid local food. I believe the menu at Express is half the size? Not like the menu at Durango location that more like book open up couple pages here just one page action. The dishes on the menu here seem to be the popular items or for me the local food enjoy the most! They run daily different specials so might want call in see if you tried the whole menu or want something else. I came to get dinner on the way home from KONA viewing party. I got steered from the one and only Shirley B get me some Furikake Chicken. Winnah! For the most part most of the pieces was good size although have to admit or agree with Marie T some of it was more deep fried crumbs. The portion size is so big but really good at same time. The sauce really enjoyed! They do put lot of sauce but then again everything here is huge including the sauce. I literally had half my two scoops of rice soaked in it. In good way.  I got some Poke action. I got the Hawaiian Style Poke Half Order. It was good. The quality of the tuna was solid, the sauce was ok, and best part was the limu. It been long time since had some. It adds so much flavor to any Poke. Good. I feel down the road Poke Express is much better and they have better selection. I would still order the Poke again if needed get my fix in.

Overall definitely place would stop by again!

My favorite goto spot for Hawaiian food. Normally get the Mixed Plate with Furikake Chicken or Shrimp with the Kalbi ribs.  Love the fact that they serve brown rice too.  Perfect for the semi-health conscious eaters looking for some clean whole grains and protein.  The portions are huge!  Mixed plate is good for two meals for me.

Definitely a place to get some good Hawaiian comfort food!!! I got the mixed plate with chicken katsu, furikake chicken, white rice and mac salad. Sooooooo good!!! Great thing is they are very island style with their portions, meaning they serve you like you've never ate before!!! Lol! They have bags of poi at the counter too if you like to add to your delicious meal. I saw the cooler by the door with Hawaiian sun drinks and guava cake and I think they had haupia cake as well. I have to get that next time :). The flavors were on point and everything was made fresh! The lady at the front is very nice and welcoming. Definitely a place full of Aloha!! Mahalo Island Flavor!

How many of you loyal diners of Island Flavor know that this business was sold in Dec. of 2017.  Bruce and Maili no longer are the owners of this business and now its owned by Viaggio-Vita-llc, a haole owned company.  Not knocking the new owners but the food quality has gone down and the taste is no longer the same.  A lot of the old time workers are no longer here and the Hawaiian music is gone, maybe forever.   A lot of new young servers are now working here which is good because they still bring the Hawaiian Mana.  Sad to say but because of changes in taste and quality of the food don't think we'll be coming back anytime soon.  Need to find another good Hawaiian restaurant again. Even the fast food outlet on Eastern was sold to the same guys that bought the original store.  SAD.  Good luck to Bruce and Maili and thanks for the wonderful years of dining experience.. Aloha oe.  One thing I've noticed is the new cooks working here.  I don't think they have the experience of Island cooking at all and our order was totally screwed.  Grand daughters spam rice came really late, and our poke didn't show up till we asked what happened.  Heard the cooks telling the servers not to ask for the food because they were backed up on orders, never seen or heard that before.  Wow what a disgraceful action from the kitchen.  Korean chicken tasted funny, Kalbi tasted over cooked, Katsu chicken came out a bit burnt and slightly hard, ummm what is going on here?  
Well, good luck to all who visit, and hopefully things will change for the better.
Ordered the Sweet & Sour Spare ribs for $9.95 - portions is good for 2-people ! Delicious !

Went here 3 times and tried different things. It's just okay. I wouldn't come back again. Idk why people from Hawaii say its good here bc I've had WAYYYY better back home. This is like a zippys to me. Just mediocre. Spam musabi had no furikake, it's  literally just nori, rice and spam. Even the 711 spam musabis are better than this! Even my homemade one is better lol. Furikake ckn didn't taste like furikake ckn it tasted like garlic ckn with a dash of furikake and SUPERRR salty. Forgot what I got before that but I guess it goes to show you how spectacular I think this place is. Oh I also tried the guava cake. Worst cake ever. Taste nothing like guava and actually ruined the taste I had in my head of the good guava and chiffon cakes back home. Maybe you guys been away from the island too long that you forgot what REAL hawaii food taste like. Sadly they are supposedly from Hawaii too. Your best bet for hawaiian/hawaii food is cinnamons!
Best Island style in Las Vegas! Healthy portions for sure! It you're looking for hearty beef stew-it's available as a special in Sat/Sun only and outs Grammy's to shame!

OMG! This place is amazing! Their friendly and very welcoming environment! They never fail to smile as soon as they see you walk in. The fact that they also remember my name, you know they treat the customers right! Food are always fresh and serving size are really worth your money! I LOVE THIS PLACE!

A flavor definitely reminiscent of the Hawaiian islands! A local stop that myself and my girlfriend (who is from Hawai'i) will constantly visit when we're in the area if we wanted taste a piece of her motherland.

We ordered their Shoyu Poke and their Furikake Chicken during this visit.

First off, the poke and the way it's cut is definitely how traditional poke should be. It was seasoned really well, close to perfection, however, this time around the seasoning was a little bit more salty than what I remembered. Still better than any poke place in California that claims to have traditional Hawaiian poke (besides North Shore, which is really close to traditional), however, as I said, it was a little bit too salty this time around. Next, is the Furikake Chicken, which is definitely something myself and my girlfriend every single time we visit Las Vegas. The crispiness of the chicken was really good, and it seemed this time they added more sauce, which I absolutely loved! For me it was very flavorful, and mixed with the warm rice they served along with it gave it a nice balance of heat and flavors in my mouth. A good balance of sweet and salty.

It pains me to do this, because I love their food so much, but the last TWO TIMES they've either messed up my order, left it sitting out without telling me it's there, forgot about making the other half of it, or a combo of all of the above. 

Tonight, we waited nearly thirty minutes as our order sat on the counter and they forgot about the furikake chicken which was sitting out in the sauce, getting cold.  They just kept pushing it to the side, serving the customers who came in long after us, and didn't even think about our food until I asked them specifically about it.

So, with the help of our home microwave, we're enjoying our food.

I got the a combo furikake chicken and Korean chicken.  The furikake chicken was pretty good but the Korean chicken was light on the sauce.

Also got he Kalbi ribs must be a different cook because it did not look like any of the other pictures posted it was burnt and dry; Most of it inedible .   The previous post noted 4 large pieces what I got was maybe 2 1/2 pieces if you put them altogether; the ribs were cut in smaller pieces.


The service was excellent


I just went again and ordered the Kallbi plate and furikake chicken.  This time I called my order in and this the Kalbi plate was a little better but the sauce was on the bottom of the box and the flavor was light on the Kalbi.  The furikake chicken was pretty good and a good portion.


Just went back again and finally got the Kalbi just right.  The reason I came back was the note I got from Bruce asking me to try it again.  The furikake chicken was consistent.   I notice the kitchen was more attentive on the preparation and execution of the food.  The previous visits the staff was lacking the attention the food needs to be presented at its best.  Well done on the Kalbi and I had Kalbi in numerous ways in South Korea; Suwon, Seoul, Bundang..etc. and this was comparable to ones I had in Suwon.
Mouth full of Hawaii flavor here!! Delicious food! Get your food early cause they get busy. Missed out on the musubi cause the party before me bought them out. Next time...
The other location tastes better. The food we order was average at most. Maybe I came in on a off day?

Perfect place to go when you're hangry.... take your hanger frustration out on this place. Its hard to find authentic poke in Las Vegas and island flavor by far has THE best!!! Super fresh and delicate! .... just sayin. Portions are large as well. Thanks for the good food and service.

Fast and friendly service as well as the best reasonable price and value for hawaiian food in vegas. I usually get the spam masubi with an ahi poke bowl, brown rice and eggs over easy on top. Also I sometimes get the bbq chicken Teriyaki with brown rice and eggs on top. Nice protein for an after gym workout session!

Island Flavor is hands down my favorite spot for local food when I'm missing the flavors of my Hawai'i! 

First of all, the portions are HUGE! I've learned after a couple visits with my family that I am not capable of finishing a plate by myself, so my sister and I always share. My favorite and what seems to be the most popular plate lunch is the Furikake Chicken. The chicken is crispy, moist, and so freaking full of flavor! I'm a creature of habit and tend to get this every time I go, but it's just too delicious to try something else! The poke is great too! The fish is cut into perfect sized cubes and it's always fresh. If you have room for dessert, they have a fridge in the corner full of different cakes... Haupia is to die for! Sometimes they even have fresh kulolo near the register that you can take to-go too! Yum!

Overall, the BEST place to go for local food in the Henderson area! Great food and even better service! The staff is awesome!

I was in love with their furikaki chicken but then the taste started changing I guess?! It went from super tasty to like really salty and then sweet. 

The huge pro is that the proportions are biiiggg! So if you are a big eater then awesome if not, then your next meal is already ready!

The kona ice cream pie looks amazing!!! I always tell myself I'm gonna order it but then by the time I leave I'm so full I can't fit anything else lol!

The loco moco is pretty huge as well. 

I love the ambience of this place too, always the local jams are on, making me miss Hawai'i so much!!

Love Island Flavor! 
We were introduced to Island Flavor when they catered a Halloween party at my kids Karate dojo. The food was so good that our family stopped by and tried it out. 
Our favorites to get are the Beef Teriyaki Steak, Kalibi Short Ribs, and the Ahi Poke.
The staff is always friendly and the food is always great. 
They were super nice when we came in at 8:30 pm to dine-in. (They close at 9.) Our kids eat slow, but they did not mind that we left 5 minutes after they closed. We didn't feel rushed at all to eat our food and get out of there.
I want to THANK Island Flavor Express for being so yummy as I remembered. Thanks guys for such great real food and professionalism. Drake

Somethings changed. Thank goodness its not all of the faces. I went in today to get my usual Furikaki Chicken and Katsu plate. 
Ownership has changed and it is begining to be seen in the portions today. I always say if it works dont change it. One of the things that separated Island Flavor from everyone else was portions, they had generous portions. Lets see what happens to your loyal base if it continues to change. Im a wait and see person. But I dont think I can rave about it if the trend continues, it will just be one of the many options available and not really stand out from the rest.

Love this place. Best local food I had so far since the 5+ years I lived in Vegas!!! Furikaki chicken is a must and don't forget the dessert. Hubby had the loco moco. It's so huge and so good. Love a ISLAND FLAVOR!!!

I'm in love with the saturation of Hawaiian restaurants in the Las Vegas area (of which the East coast surely misses out on) and another welcome addition is Island Flavor.  The prices are slightly higher than some of its competitors but the quantity and good flavor surely makes up for that.

There are quite a few options of fresh ahi tuna poke here.  I ordered 1/2 a pound of Hawaiian style poke.  The cuts of tuna they used were very large and quite fresh.  It was marinated in a soy and chili flake sauce with some minced onions thrown in the mix.  Pretty good option for poke in my area.

The mixed plate we ordered was fairly good as well.  Furikake chicken was spot on, kind of like crispy orange chicken but with more flavor from the furikake seasoning.  The kalbi short ribs ($1.00 more) were good and came as 2 huge pieces of meat.   There's quite a bit of fat on edges which I did not eat and one of our meats came out a little more red on the inside than my wife likes to eat.  Luckily, I have no problem with that.

I've glanced over some of the breakfast options and saw the Portuguese sausage and eggs at over $8.    That's $3 more than I'm used to for a standard breakfast option.  I decided to get a side of the Portuguese sausage but they were considerably smaller and not as good as my go to spot for Portuguese sausage (Aloha Kitchen next to UNLV for those wondering-amazing).

For the closest location with good poke and friendly service, I'll definitely keep Island Flavor in mind.  Truly a good mixed plate with plenty of left overs for a second meal.
Nice hole in the wall, North of 215 on Eastern so you don't have to deal with much traffic. Yummy poke!
DELISH!! Thought the pics of the combo was only going to disappoint!! NOPE. REALLY FAIR portions for the price. SUPER TASTY!! we will be back!!

Great authentic Hawaiian food. Tried the Loco Moco & Hawaiian Style Roast Pork. Portions are very generous for the price. Most food are under $10. Finished off with the Chantilly & Guava Cake. Very good!!! Just like on the island. Will definitely be back for more and this place is highly recommended!

Sad to say that the portions have changed. Rumor is that there's a new owner, I wouldn't be surprised if they're not from Hawaii. It's like they don't know how much Hawaii people eat or how much real Hawaiian food means to us (we're going to notice that the Kalbi lost half of its weight and we're going to care). 

Food is still good. Service is still great. And Thank goodness. 

For the 10yrs we've been going to this restaurant (not this location of course), they've stayed consistent and that's what we love about them. It breaks our heart that this is happening.

I don't get why this place has a 4.5 average rating. I JUST finished eating (what I managed to eat) and after 1 short rib, I was over it. 

Look at all my pictures, and you'll see what I'm talking about. 

Short ribs: waaaaaaay too much fat. After eating just 1 short rib, I had a big pile of fat sitting on a napkin. And nibbling on the bones is usually my favorite part about short ribs. I couldn't do it with these because I refuse to eat pure fat.

Furikake chicken: the majority of the serving was the crumbs/breading. There were only a few big pieces of chicken. 

Korean short ribs: mushy and all breading. 

Don't get me wrong, the flavoring of the short ribs and furikake chicken were good, but the execution was a huge disappointment. Sometimes trying new places isn't always a good thing.

Island Flavor is a mostly-take-out based Hawaii food place.  There are a few tables but during the popular hours it is hard to find a seat.  The food is quite good.  For the price, it is a good amount of food.  Have tried the teriyaki chicken which was pretty good.  The poke have large chunks of fish which is generous.  Though my favorite is probably the guava cake.  Will continue to come back!
Ok, this is the mother of all Hawaiian food in LV. You can't go wrong when ordering anything on the menu and the quality of the kalbi ribs are second to none. And the loco moco though...smh.
The food is delicious but the service is terrible. Just beware when you go in you will have a rude cashier who doesn't care about doing his job.

Yup, this place is officially my fav Hawaiian plate lunch spot to go to in Henderson! Went here over this past weekend and ordered a two item combo of the Kalbi ribs and Teri Steak. Just like that with no rice. The cashier was ultra kind enough to rework my order so that I was just paying for sides of the meat instead of normal plate lunch cause I didn't want the rice and mac salad. (trying to lower my carb intake).  That was awesome of him!

Its a grab and go type place even though there is some seating available. So just expect that. I look forward to coming back with the fam to try more things.

This is my favorite Hawaiian food in town. So why 3
stars? Because they're always so rude and uncaring. The service is horrible, but I go back for the food. I'm glad I don't crave Hawaiian food all that much otherwise I'd probably avoid this place and go up the street to Ohana where the service is way more friendly. 

Anyway, the last time I came in, there were 3 women up at the seating area. I had ordered to go. All 3 women had seen me and I smiled at them, but all looked away and continued doing what they were doing. I understand being busy, but at least say hi, especially if I've already maintained eye contact and smiled at you. 

It took a good few minutes for one of them to finally verbally acknowledge me and gather my order. There was another order right next to mine. After I paid, they just started to walk away. I said, "oh are both these bags mine?" And she said, "no, just this one" and looked annoyed. Okayyyyyy so then how would I know whose is whose, I'm not a mind reader. 

Will I be back? Probably within the next 6 months, sure. This wasn't the first time there were blatantly rude. Could be the culture? I've been to Hawaii multiple times and have cousins from there but they all seems nice...no idea what's going on here?

The food here is outta control.  The Mac salad is seasoned just right, not too much mayo but just enough.  The rice is tender and warm, as it should be but isn't always the case at other spots. I ordered their furikake chicken.  That was so bomb. I haven't had that before. So, that was a nice change. The flavor of the furikake really shined through and paired with rice in each bite, it was a great balance of flavor between the taste of the chicken protein, the furikake and the sauce on the food. I can't even begin to tell you how massive the adobo friend rice was too. I was not expecting anything as huge as what we got. My husband and I picked up food from here before heading to the airport. I didn't think that we'd have any trouble finishing our food but boy, we ended up consolidating both our left overs into a single take out box and well, we still had enough food for someone to enjoy a complete meal.  Their portions are large and their prices are just right for us, under $10 per plate, with the exception of an item or two depending on whether it's a special or if it's fish/seafood.  The folks who work here are friendly and witty. They're chatty but not overly so. I'd love to come back and try more things. They accept cards, thankfully. I tipped them in cash. I just don't think that you could go wrong eating here. Yum!

Salty, meaty, and not a hint of pineapple, Truly Hawaiian comfort food.

Such a great spot for a quick bite, that way you can get back to instagramming food-stuffs and checking the Netflix library. I was doing all of the above while I waited for my food. 

I went with Hamburger Steak, a 10 oz. patty broiled and topped with mushrooms, onions, and brown gravy. This is a tasty Hawaiian standard; the hamburger was juicy, the onions were still snappy and the brown sauce coated everything. This plate of food comes with house made macaroni salad, because what goes better with a heavy ass meal, than pasta covered in mayo. 

You want classic, "Island Flavor" (ha, see what I did there?) this place has it spades, including Musubi, a seaweed snack with spam and rice. Nummers. 

Mahola, Island Flavor. Mahalo.

JUST GO. This company consistently makes some of the best island food that I've had in the lower 48. Every time I come to Las Vegas, I actually get excited to eat Island Flavor again. This is their quickie express version with counter service and a few tables. 

First things first: haupia cake. It's perfect in texture, and the haupia flavor is subtle and beautiful. I ate dessert while waiting a few minutes for my plate lunch. (The cream on it isn't particularly special, but the rest of the cake is PERFECT.) 

Next: unless you are Michael Phelps or the god Maui out of the movie Moana, these meals are filling enough for two people to share. Holy hell, there's so much fatty, delicious food that it's surely grave to your health on a regular basis. It's all good quality and done with great flavors. They are on the sweet side, but my favorites are the furikake chicken and short ribs. 

Like Durango's location, the service here is so unbelievably kind that you can't help but wish the whole world could live life like that everyday. (To the lady working today, THANK YOU. So much aloha in your heart that the world must be a better place because you are in it!) 

They have daily specials posted on the wall when you walk in and everything legit Hawaiian on the menu, including all those glorious Pacific Rim fusion meals. 

I'm at McCarran waiting to go home and packed my leftovers in a Tupperware. I even had to tell the TSA guy to eat here when he did a bag check for me. This is one of my favorite local businesses to support!
In love this place. I am a long time customer of Ross J's but this place is giving them a run for their money. Korean ribs and that furikake chicken is crazy good.

Was in town for a night and checked Yelp for something close by to eat. After striking out at two other nearby locations with great reviews (closed cause it was Black Friday) we tried Island Flavor. It was smaller than I had imagined, one unit in a small strip mall. There were maybe 6 small tables along the wall, but people were filing in and out at a steady pace. Very busy, but that could have been due to it being Black Friday and many other restaurants were closed. I ordered the miso ahi steaks, perfectly cooked with a tasty sauce and rice, my wife got teriyaki chicken, also very good. The staff was friendly and even attentive, unexpected, considering it was more of a fast food atmosphere. Both meals together cost about $20. Accommodations could have been more friendly/inviting if they had a bigger location, but I think they cater more to take out. If  you're not a fan of the hustle & bustle, get it to go, it's worth it. Very Good food
Great tasty food, fast service and welcoming aloha spirit. Real enjoyed the food so Ono! Broke da mouth.....

I was in Vegas with my hubby for his work and I had to have lunch alone one day. I had been craving Hawaiian food and this restaurant happened to be pretty close to the hotel we stayed at and since I'm a horrible driver in places I'm not familiar with, I figured I needed to stay close by. I'm so glad I did because this place is amazing. The chicken katsu entree was absolutely delicious. The price was great especially for the amount of food they give you, I couldn't even finish my plate. The customer service was excellent. Everything was fresh and tasted just as good and authentic as it would if you were eating it in Hawaii.
The Beef Teriyaki Steak plate was so good. The meat was tender and juicy, the way it should be! I will be coming back for more.

This is my favorite Hawaiian spot so far. I eat here at least once a week or try to atleast. I usually order the kalbi beef with the tossed salad or try whatever specials they have that I haven't tried yet. 

Thier sweet and sour spareribs was was real good. A bit sweet bit I like it sweet. 

Thier oxtail soup was great! Though I think by the time I got to try it, it was a bit salty. A friend of mine went there earlier that day and said it was good but maybe that's cuz he went there right when they opened so it wasn't too salty yet. But it was real tender. 

I advise everyone to try this place out. Thier food is not only good, but they also give you big portions.
My food was delicious!  I got the teriyaki beef and was beyond thrilled. Ton of food. Wish we lived here so I could try more of the menu. Next time in Vegas for sure.

Furicaki (spelling???)Chicken is amazing and my favorite. All the Staff is attentive to the customers even if they aren't in their section. Food is freshly cooked and has a flavor like no other. Kalbi ribs are the thickest I have had yet. The Fried Rice is so so damn good. Anything that you get, I guarantee it will be delicious.
Bad service no one took my order and I was there for 15 minutes. Everyone there ignored us

Me and wife stop by pick up the food today...i order combo plates furikake chicken and roasted pork. Roasted pork was good and tender but I prefer with out gravy better. Wife order omelet fried rice and spam musubi she doesn't like either one...fried rice to salty and egg is no seasoning it all how can and Asian restaurant mess up just plain fried rice with eggs I don't get it..and spam musubi seem like they make it a day before and put in the fridge and reheat in the warmer the next day. Overall if I going to spent 30 dollars for the food I would like to enjoy it not to throw half of it away.

Legit. Best plate lunch in Vegas and they give choke food.  

Furikake chicken is awesome. Kulolo is on point. Hamburger steak was ono too.  They also have guava chiffon and chantilly cake slices in a fridge to grab.  This place is a must stop for me whenever I'm in Vegas.  Don't miss out!

Have been there 3 times since they opened last week. 1st visit: sweet & sour spareribs: onolicious. Wife got poke salad. Large portion and really tasty.
2nd visit: furikake chicken:  oh so good. The wife got the loco moco. She loved it! 
Today, 3rd time. Laulau Friday. Oh yeah with Komi salmon, mac salad & haupia for dessert. So Ono.
You gotta go there!
This place is good and the girl working the front is great! The Mexican looking cook not so much. He is given instruction on how to cook the food and ignores them

Apparently I ordered a large plate of kalbi fatty ribs.  

So much fat, 1 pc was all meat.  All the other 8 pieces were all fat.

The cooks are messed up for putting a dish like this together.

I'm so happy I found this place. It's great for lunch.  This location is east of the strip and it's considered "express."  I guess their menu isn't as extensive as the other location on the west side of the strip.  Parking was easy to find; they have a small lot in front of the restaurant.  They also have restrooms in the back and condiments/utensils in the front by the sodas.  

The menu is on the wall in front of the kitchen.  I ordered a combo of kalbi and furikaki chicken.  I wanted to try the pork, but maybe on a next visit.  The combo came with a side of macaroni salad, and I opted for white rice instead of brown rice.  Both meats were delicious.  Furikaki chicken is something I've never heard of before, and I love furikaki!  It's a bit on the sweet side, so I recommend getting it in the combo.  

I'll definitely be back next time - maybe to try the poke, too!

The staff was really friendly and the restaurant was clean. It was my cheat meal so I went with the Loco Moco as well as a side of the guava cake. Loco Moco was perfect with the massive hamburger patty drenched in delicious gravy over a huge bed of rice. The eggs was over easy and cooked to perfection. That's always a good measure on how well people can cook as how they produce egg dishes. 
The guava cake was a nice balance of flavor and sweetness and was not to filling so I was able to finish it off at the end of a meal. I think I love this location better than the one in Southwest Vegas.
Not many places make me come back as often as this location, the furikake chicken is so good.

It was a weird night blaze pizza had a line out the door five guys ran out of hamburger buns and I just started driving in circles and found this place so I was not in the best of moods and I ordered it to go it's not like Hawaiian restaurants/chains around town have really thrilled me but it was packeand had awesome reviews so far

The staff  were very friendly pointing to the specials on the board which look interesting like a mahi-mahi  but I have my mind set on the short ribs and I got the teriyaki chicken 2 item combo basically for $12.50 I got three of the better tasting and thick Short ribs I've ever had and some very tasty teriyaki chicken and rice along with some macaroni salad

Everything was delicious very hard for me to give any restaurant like this a five star, but at this place stays consistent l,  it might make it there


So I went back for lunch and even better, the short ribs and furikake (sp?) chicken, wow now 5 stars

And the 3rd time now is just as tasty!!! Go-go-go
Furikake chicken was yum! And my family was happy with the poke and kale.  Friendly service and nice area for eat-in.

Nice hawaiian place outside the Vegas strip. We want to try something that is not on strip and fairly cheaper. This is a good place to eat cheap and large portion food. I like the furikake chicken the most. Amazing sauce and tender chicken. The korean chicken is awesome, similar to KFC original batter but with a sauce on it. Mixed plate is only for 11.50 which is a good deal for this type of meal. Kalbi is also amazing. Would like to eat there again if I go to Vegas again.

Wow!!! Amazing !!! Tried this place out for the first time and all I can say is why didn't I know this place existed. Ordered the chicken adobo and chicken furikake and both were so good. Very generous portions. We left that place with happy bellies. Will definitely be coming back soon.

This place is laid out like a capriottis on the inside. Bar to order from and then a few high tables. First time there today and it was so good! I got bbq chicken which had really good flavoring. I upgraded to fried rice for $2 and it was so worth it. The flavoring was great for both items I had! Would have given it five stars but I had a few fatty pieces in my chicken that made me give it only four stars. The staff was friendly and nice to be around. It was excellent and I'll be coming back!

I eat here at least twice a week.  Always the same thing.  Mixed plate with their furikake chicken and Kali ribs with fried rice.  The staff is always amazing and the food is quick.  I can't recommend this place enough.  Kahele who works the front is fantastic at customer service.  I don't write reviews often but this is one of those rare places that compels me to do so.

My FAVORITE place to eat at when I'm in Sin City. So glad they've got this new spot. Furukaki Chicken is my go to dish, and the portions are ample enough to satisfy this island girl and her Samoan husband. Different types of poke and desserts. I've never made a trip Vegas without stopping here for some good local food.

Food is so good and very consistent, have done take out from here 4-5 times. Even in its location it does well, put this place south of 215 on Eastern and it would have a line out the door. Basically it's a hidden gem right down the street. Have not had a bad dish yet, portions are big and food is cooked well.

I love this place, there service was amazing, the chicken was so good!  It was different, but soooo good.  The fried rice was also different but so so good.  And that macaroni salad was freaking amazing!  I didn't think I would like the Mac salad.  But I gobbled that right up.   I started to go back and get another side of it.  I will be back.....Soon!  Maybe tomorrow!
Visited Las Vegas and a coworker recommended this place.  Service was great and they cooked the food to my order.  Would definitely come again.

Our First visit was great! Ordered the mixed plate kalbi ribs and ckn furikake, it was so good!!! Loved the side of mac salad. Didn't get the name of the cashier but she was so nice and checked on us, made us feel welcomed. Walked out with more than enough for left overs. Will be referring my friends and definitely returning!

I really enjoyed Island Flavor's other location and was glad they opened another location on this side of town. Know for their larger portions this location didn't disappoint!

I stopped in for my favorite mixed plate of Kalbi ribs and Furiake Chicken and added Fried Rice instead of the white rice and its served with mac salad. Perfect flavors all around and it was enough for two meals. I also grabbed a piece of the Chantilly cake that was in a small cooler near the door. Perfect dessert for me, not two sweet and the cake was nice and moist.

Vegas is known as the 9th Island and with eateries like this all we are missing is the Beaches, Weather, and so on and so on.....! At least we can eat good!
I have been coming back to this place! The food is amazing and I love the Big Island feel you get when you come in. Everyone is so friendly and down to earth. Must try the BEEF teriyaki
