I absolutely love this place. The food is amazing and they really hook you up with huge proportions. I've become quite a regular customer here. The people are very nice and it's the perfect place to get take out on those lazy nights that you don't feel like cooking anything for dinner.

This place is good.. I love coming here so much.. I always look forward to Friday cause of the Laulau.. it's so moist and Delish... I just like go home and slip into a food coma but I always come here before lol..or during my breaks

This place is way better than L,L!! Drove up from Cali and was craving some island food. Came here and everyone was so friendly. Hubby had the Roast Pork Loco Moco, I had the Furikake Chicken. Both were super delicious!! Great food, great service! Oh and don't forget to grab  yourself a slice of Guava cake, it's off the chain!!
Totally love Island Flavor. Usually go to the one on Durango so I'm glad that I found one closer to my new place. The food is great and the atmosphere is amazing.
Outstanding...could be my favorite place to pick up some good eats. Nothing fancy just good Hawaiian food at a good price. The staff is great as well

I've already given this place 1 star prior because the owner HUNG UP on me and was so rude. Tried to contact for weeks straight to get a quote and the owner hung up THEN threatens to contact my manager because I put the review on yelp . DO NOT GO THERE HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

Hate to say it, but my next door local kine jam is losing stars. Tonight was the second time I've gotten mushy rice. Last time, I thought it was just because I ordered brown rice (which isn't really standard), but I got the house white tonight for good measure and proved myself wrong. Hawaiians don't do mushy rice...It's an everyday thing where I'm from. Maybe someone just isn't paying attention here. Little too much char on the kalbi too. Possibly just a super off day, but too many other good spots around the way to be doing it wrong.

Guava cake from the off-site bakery was good though.

Sitting here watching my food being prepared, Hawaiian food by Hawaiian people ok. Most Hawaiians know only use Aloha shoyu  nothing but right?  Nope looking right at kikkomans!! Cheap bags of white rice piled high by the side over here. Ugh some 'original Hawaiian style'. Stay away

Seriously, I would never come back! The service is ok but the food is just so... Im lost for words. I ordered the korean chicken, musubi, etc. The chicken was full of batter and I felt like I was going to get a heart attack just looking at it. The musubi was sitting for a while and was just below average. I guess it represents the name as Express but seriously... if you want better quality food, just go next door to Jun's in the same building! I was debating between the two and because I always go to Juns I figured id try this place out. Never again!
I love this place! Service is attentive. Food is affordable with big portions. Really delicious food. Whenever I'm in town I have to eat here

The best Hawaiian food! Order the furikake chicken it's bomb! Very friendly staff and love the Hawaiian music! When you order here they make you feel like u in Hawaii! I recommend this place over L&L it's wayyyyy better than them! Island flavor has a good rep so you won't be disappointed! Aloha!

our first visit to this location!  We've been to their other location several times and at both places that poke is No Ka Oi!!!!!!!!  The Kalbi, Katsu and Roast pork and Mac salad are all on point too!  It was nice because they substitute rice for fries which my boys loved!  Going back for lunch tomorrow and maybe on Sunday before we leave haha!
Overcooked to the point you could barely chew/cut the katsu chicken with mushy rice. Never again..
Ono grindz! Food is on point! Had the oxtail soup super delicious and plenty of meat and veggies. My hubby order beef steak Teri and had left overs and the meat still tender!

I've been here plenty of times. Every time the service and food is good. The people who work there are very kind and serve to make sure your happy. 

The food again is one of a kind. I highly recommend that you try fukaki chicken, spam musabi, teriyaki chicken, and etc... everything here is really good. Every time I'm in town this is always a MUST place to stop at. Love it.

First time there! I got the furikake chicken and my bf got the Hawaiian poke. It was so good and I got a lot of chicken I actually went home with a lot of leftovers and I eat ALOOOOT. Also, there was a bit of a wait so she threw in a free musubi! I thought that was awesome. Prices are $10-15 per item

Best plates in town. Portion sizes are insane and they make sure that doesn't take anything away from quality and taste of food. 

My go to is the loco moco or Furikake chicken with Kalbi combo. But I recently tried the kimchi fried rice with Korean chicken wings and that definitely hit the spot when looking for something with a little kick.

Best Loco Moco in town!!

I actually prefer this location over the Durango one.  I know they're supposed to be the same, but I think get bigger servings here.  Island Flavor has huge portions and their prices can't be beat.  The only item that I have ever had at this location is their Loco Moco.  In my opinion, Island Flavor has the best Loco Moco in Las Vegas.  The patties are huge/thick, you get a lot of eggs, and there's tons of rice & gravy.  After eating here, I'm set for at least 3.7 hours.  I look forward to coming back when I'm in the area.  

2017 Yelp Review #37

The poke was fresh and well-prepared.  Perfect cut on the fish (not too small, not too big).  Great seasoning.  Again I wish had the fat limu... But when in the desert...  Also a bit heavy on the onion, but ono none the less.

Furikake chicken is always a favorite with the kids.  Same awesome quantity and quality as usual!

Great Grinds!

I expected a really mindblowing experience after all the hype around the original location and the positive comparisons drawn between the two, but the Eastern outpost of this restaurant lands merely in the "really good" category.

Island Flavor Express is in the Regal Colonnade plaza on Eastern and Pebble, and it's very clearly a Hawaiian restaurant given all the depictions of the islands, reggae/ska music, and typical plate lunch menu options. They also offer varying specials and some desserts, although the desserts seemed to have run out in the waning evening hours. The decor is very simple but doesn't detract from the experience. Make sure to walk to the far end of the counter to place an order, but feel free to sit down if you're not taking it to-go. They'll bring the food out to your counter (or table, if you've picked the one table).

I ordered the mixed plate ($11.25) with Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Short Ribs (+$1.00 for this particular meat). It's presented in a foam to-go box even if you're dining in. My favorite part was actually the macaroni salad, which was salted in a good way, and as creamy as you'd expect. The chicken was kinda like the "KFC" at Gen Korean BBQ in a not-so-good way. It has more of a dry, stringy texture than a moist, natural chicken texture, and the furikake didn't stand out as much as the sweet glaze did. Sriracha saved the day though, bestowing a little extra sweetness along with much-needed acidity and heat. I don't like having to add a condiment to make something stand out, but I'm very glad that I had the option.

As for the other parts of the dish, the white rice is cooked perfectly, and the kalbi is a great rendition with tender beef, a nice touch of ginger, and some charring. It's a little on the fatty side, but let's remember that fat = flavor, which was proven in this case. Actually, it has muted sweetness when you eat it after something as sweet as the Furikake Chicken, but I was able to taste the full flavor when I dove into my my leftovers. If I get a mixed plate again with kalbi, I'll probably have to go for something like a pork dish that's not so sweet.

My friend shared a spam musubi ($2) with me. It was a nice-sized portion, but the rice ratio was a bit high for me. Also, the seaweed was a little too mushy, which my friend pointed out may be a side-effect of the heat lamp. Although there are interesting seasonings and herbs in Island Flavor's version, I prefer the Ross J's rendition, which I'm sure is prepped to order.

I also tried my friend's oxtail soup ($10), which actually comes in a real bowl if you're dining in. Unfortunately, I can't compare it to the renowned Hawaiian oxtail soup at that one hotel downtown (because I've yet to try it), but this version tasted well-seasoned and meaty. The vegetables are a welcome sight, but watch out for the not-so-edible ginger and the inedible bay leaf. I'd consider ordering it again, especially now that we're getting soup weather daily, although I might have to make it a to-go order or otherwise bring my own soup spoon to avoid dealing with the inadequate plastic spoons.

Given that the food here is reportedly much the same as OG Island Flavor, I wasn't quite as impressed as I'd hoped. I certainly enjoyed having plenty of leftovers with the huge portions, and I'll definitely come back to try their other proteins and specials (pork chops w/ mushrooms and onions, anyone?), but I expected to experience something "sublime" other than the music. Maybe I'll find it in the future.

I am so glad I found a closer Island Flavor. Though this one is smaller (since it's an "express") it's definitely just as delicious! The food quality is always there and the staffs friendliness makes the experience that much greater!
Love Island Flavor!!!! Everything is yummy!!! One of the first places I recommend when people are looking for local food!!
LOVE this place. The food is sooo good. The furikake chicken is amazing and the teriyaki steak is so delicious.

I love this place. Nice to have an Island Flavor on the east side/ Henderson area. Their west side location a sit down restaurant and quite a distance. Everything on the menu is tasty. Never had bad service here. I Usually call my orders in. My favorite plate on the menu is the Furikake chicken. Kalbi ribs and the Korean chicken wings are really tasty as well! Portion size are great! Can't really describe the food, but it's bomb. Check it out for yourself.

Can't be better than this. Food is exactly on point. When you order Hawaiian it supposed to be a certain way and this is the way it's supposed to be. 
They pile the food on. It's funny because I reviewed another Hawaiian place not long ago and complained about the how their portions were too big. Well the big difference here is they give you a lot of delicious food unlike that other place that gives you a bunch of nasty food. 
Kalbi here is very good. They give plenty. Ahi poke is fresh and delicious. Furikake chicken has really good flavor. 
I'm a regular now. I will be here weekly for sure.

The service I'd always good. The food is amazing!! 
Fried saimin is so ono
Meat Jun is so tasty , don't even need the sauce but it it makes it better 
Mandoo is soft and crispy.. 
Love it!!!

I'm from Hawaii so I know wassap. The chicken katsu was standard. I love their furikake chicken and short ribs. I think it's the best island flavor style food in Vegas. My most favorite. But I have to drop a star ever since they raised prices on the ribs. My mix plate was $15 bucks. If 15 pesos then yeah, it's ok, but not $15 bucks. I want to comeback but I don't want to feel guilty spending neither. Definitely not taking a date here. We're going to Island Burger King Flavor. Oh you don't like Burger King? Pshh..sorry. Too expensive. If I spend, I can just see the calculator in my head subtracting digits from my bank account. I don't like how they raised prices just coz they can. Side note, pho kim long use to be a good foodie spot till they raised prices. Now it's infested with hipsters and pho ding dongs. The end.

Best Hawaiian food!!! 


love getting their mixed plate because you can choose 2 different meat with rice and Mac salad. 


This place is the closest place to get my favorite comfort food.

Just tried this place for the first time today. Probably the best meal I have had since moving to Vegas 2 years ago, and I eat out a lot. The Kalbi ribs, furikake chicken, terrayaki chicken were all 10/10. Can not wait to come back.

Vegas is called the ninth Hawaiian island for a reason - so. much. good. Hawaiian food, and Island Flavor has to be one of the best! The restaurant is more of a take out shop, but there are enough tables/chairs that you'll be able to eat in if you choose. 
Furikake chicken: Imagine orange chicken, but better. The quality of rice here is always a lot better than the other restaurants I go to. The rice is a little closer to the moist flavorful Japanese rice than that dry white stuff they call rice here in America. The macaroni salad is GOOD. I hate to admit it but since Macaroni salad is the one thing you always get at every Hawaiian restaurant, it plays a big part in how I rank my Hawaiian restaurants. The macaroni salad here does not disappoint. Super creamy, super thick, just how I like it. 
Spam musubi: The one here at Island Flavor has furikake in it instead of the usual brown sauce. If you're expecting the sweet sauce flavor that spam musubi usually has, you might be a little disappointed in the one here. 
Katsu chicken: Super thick pieces of katsu! the breading to chicken ratio has to perfect and Island Flavor really gets it down.

Great food but.....  Just recently went in to order my favorite Kalbi short rib plate which originally cost ($11.00).... today 3/13/2018 I paid ($17.00) for the NEW KALBI PLATE price?!! That's just too much.  That's a $6 increase.  Ridiculous.

One of my favorite hawaiian restaurants creates a sister location much closer to me! My answers have been prayers! confused? So am I since this location is not like the original one on durango.

Setting: In the regal colonade plaza on pebble, it is right next to a smoke shop and on the side of PT's Ranch. A smaller restaurant but still places to sit and eat. 

Service: Service here is fantastic. I have never received bad service especially from a Hawaiian restaurant. The young lady behind the counter was very engaging and we ended up talking more than I had time to eat haha.

Food: Ok the most important part. The furikake chicken and kalbi are the stars of this show here. Luckily the kalbi is still on point but their signature furikake chicken is different. They over fry and batter their furikake chicken and makes them really hard and crunchy. NO BUENO!!! Cut back on the batter and don't fry them to the point where they're gonna start popping like popcorn. Also AVOID AVOID getting the furikake shrimp, same story as the chicken and they only give you 4 pieces of shrimp.

Overall: I want to just drive to the original location but this spot is way more convenient. Pleaseeeee follow up on my review about the frying process! Thanks guys!

Island flavor is by far best hawaiian local place to eat at here in the 702! Always taking home food, portions are huge! Worth the $$$. Kalbi, Furikaki Chicken, Hamburger Steak, & Furikaki Poke is all winners! Everything is just amazing there!

Two words:  Furikake Chicken!!!  This is BOMB.com. Your tastebuds will thank you and then you can thank me for saving you some time from wondering what to order.  No seriously!  Ok, ok the pork roast is good too but don't order the oxtail soup...if you're thinking oxtail soup from California Hotel, not even close!  You can go to California Hotel for their oxtail because they do have the best soup in town!  

Overall, best Hawaiian food that I can get in my side of town other than Island Sushi.

I used to go to the other location, and was very happy when they opened this up just down the street from me.  As stated in its name it's island flavor express, so it's a smaller version.  The seating is minimal but there are still a few tables, and the menu is smaller as they occilate some items as specials.  There have been some hits and misses.  One big plus is their fried poke salad.  You order which marinade you want on your poke, I always get shoyu, and I ask them just to sear the cubes of poke as well.  This is a big deal because the other location always over cooked it for me, and here it's perfection.  The salad is about 16, but that is because it comes with a ridiculously large amount of poke.  It's easily a salad for two to three people, except you need more greens actually lol.  I love the purple taro that they put inside so much and the crispy wontons, there is also cucumbers and tomato.  The creamy sesame dressing is totally addicting as well.  I wish they had a half salad order option where they just give half the poke when you are ordering on your own.

The traditional poke uncooked and also in shoyu sadly does not compare to the other location, both times the way it was cut was not not promoting the best mouth feel, and was chewy instead of like butter.  You might as well just go to island sushi and grill down the street since theirs is always on point.

The kalbi is cooked nicely, however for me it was just to salty.  

Each time I have ordered it has been for pick up, they always package it nicely and with a smile, and are more organized than the other location in this respect.  

So basically the only dish I have really loved has been the poke salad, while the other items I am not interested in ordering again.  I give them a solid 3 and hope to raise it in the future. That poke salad is totally a 5 though on its own
I love and really appreciate that I can substitute for brown rice with no extra charge

Now this is some serious Hawaiian food. The furikake chicken is truly an experience of its own, and their musubis are only something you'd get actually on the islands or from a grandmother's kitchen. Very crowded, but service was good, and the portions are crazy huge! I am a big eater, and it was extremely hard for me to finish the two option mix plate that comes with a bunch of rice and macaroni salad. Do not miss out on their musubis. Do not miss out on that chicken!

This is my favorite casual Hawaiian restaurant in town so far. 

As soon as we walked in we were warmly greeted by the woman that was taking and delivering orders to customers. She showed us the specials and asked if we had any questions as we reviewed the menu, but she didn't rush us. 

The inside of the restaurant only has about five tables, but is clean and organized. I definitely felt comfortable dining inside the restaurant. 

I had the Mixed Plate with Kalbi Short Ribs & Furikake Shrimp. The Kalbi Short Ribs had great flavor, plenty of meat, and most pieces had more meat than fat. The slight char on each rib was perfect. The Furikake Shrimp had a the perfect amount of breading and the seasoning on the breading had a nice flavor. The white rice  was simple, but well prepared. The macaroni salad was so good! I loved the black pepper taste and the dressing on the macaroni. 

My husband also had a Mixed Plate, but with Chicken Katsu and Kalua Pig & Cabbage. The Chicken Katsu was very tasty with tender chicken and the breading was tasty. The Kalua Pig & Cabbage also had great flavor with tender meat.

Of course I couldn't pass on a piece of Guava cake to take home. Guava is such an underused fruit and I love the guava in this cake. The cake has great flavor and is very moist. 

Both meals had very generous portions of both meat and sides. I see why meals are served in to go containers after seeing the portions. We definitely had a decent amount of leftovers. I like that plastic bags are out to help with taking leftovers home. Prices are reasonable given the portions and quality.

Food was awesome!! Large portions and poke is fresh and flavorful. Isaiah the cashier was very nice and helpful. You can tell he is a hard worker. Even with a long line and busy to go orders he still managed to give the best service and smile to everyone who walked in the door. Will be coming back and I recommend it to people who love Hawaiian food.

Love this place! It's my third time here today! Never been disappointed. Smells like heaven right when you walk in! I've had breakfast and two lunches. Just had my first moco and I'm going loco! 

I've tried Malibu short ribs jatsu and loco moco! Try and get here before the spam masubis run out!

I enjoyed eating here for the first time, recommended by a friend. Food was delicious and the wait time for the food was pretty short. Was easy to find and had good parking. The fried rice omlette was really good and was a big portion.

This is a great slice of back home (Hawaii). So happy they opened a location on my side of town. Ono food, Big Island hospitality. This place is definitely a winner! Try everything on the menu when you get a chance. The new regular spot for me and all the boiz!

I have heard from a couple friends that I had to come eat here! One who moved from Hawaii and raves about this local spot. So glad we decided to come eat here for dinner! 
The chefs were friendly from the moment we walked in. The cashier Shugs was very helpful and polite when we ordered from her. The food was amazing and was served in generous portions! Overall a great spot on all levels!

Where has this been place all of my life?! That Furikake glazed chicken is to DIE for. The staff is super friendly however the location is small. We went around 1230pm and the place was pretty packed with people. Glad we called our order ahead of time or else we would've spent our whole lunch hour probably waiting. The place seems like it's family owned and you can see everything out in the open. From the spices they use on the top shelf to the chicken that comes out of the fridge before it gets fried. Pretty cool. Your plates will come standard with 2 scoops of rice and Mac salad. I wish they opened one close to home!
Friendly service! Isiah showed amazing customer service and chef Steven cooked the food very well. Definitely recommend this place!
My favorite Hawaiian spot! Glad there's one on our side. The furikake chicken is amazing! Breaded chicken with a sweet sauce and furikake seasoning. Big portions, so come hungry.
awesome service and delicious food!!!! fresh and sooo good i will be coming here  more often im so glad its close to home !!!

Stopped by for a quick lunch around 12:30pm and barely missed the lunch rush! The place itself has a decent amount of seating but would not recommend this place for large groups, probably for parties of 4 or less. Now onto the food:

Mixed Plate (Kalbi and Furikake Chicken) - would definitely recommend sharing this. You get a choice of rice, brown rice (no extra charge), or fries. You also get a choice of macaroni salad or salad. The furikake chicken was sooooo good and the seasoning was on point! The kalbi was a bit chewy and not all the pieces were flavored well so I would recommend trying something else. Macaroni salad was decent. I just wish they had more sauces to eat with the rice.

Food was excellent!  Service was great.  Met the owners who were in the restaurant and they were delightful.  I had the Kalua pork with cabbage and the flavor was outstanding.  The meat was seasoned and the food was fresh.  The restaurant is clean, and has a great Hawaiian ambience.  I felt like I went to the islands!  Overall great experience.
Very tasty and authentic Hawaiian eats in a fast casual environment.  The portions are very generous and orders arrive quickly.  Good stuff.

So so good. Real authentic amazing Hawaiian food. The furikake chicken and shrimp is soo good. The service is amazing. They even let you swap out salad or veggies or French fries instead of the usual rice or macaroni salad. Great prices and huge portions. My new favorite!!

Island Flavor is by far the closest you'll get to real Hawaiian food! I'm so stoked they open a new location right next to me, although I'd drive the distance to their west side location too. The costumer service is always welcoming, feels like you coming home to family. 

Furakaki chicken & Chop Steak is my choice from the menu .

I recommend this place to all my friends when they ask me where To go to get Hawaiian food. If you never been here, your missing out!

Small shop with 7 tables that sat 4.  Tried the Loco Moco with eggs over easy, one egg oozed the yolk the other a little over done but no matter the brown sauce and portion size made up for it.  I almost dropped the container because it was so heavy with food.  Also ordered the Avo Poke, again good quality fish.  Recommend this for the freshness of the food.

Okay Island Flavor. We see you!! 

Kids wanted Musubis for dinner, and some local grinds sounded so ono, so Island Flavor was next on the rotation. And I'm pretty sure the rotation stops here. Look no further for fresh, traditional, island favorites, with fantastic friendly service. We really felt like ohana tonight. 

Kalbi is so tender and succulent, Furikake Chicken is more flavorful than any I've ever had on the mainland, and the Teryaki Chicken... Well let's just say the kids ate almost a whole plate to themselves, and they're damn picky! Hubby says their mac salad rivals mine, and that's saying a lot (and I may have to agree). (Food was too good, no pictures this time!)

Complete with Pass-O-Guava and Lilikoi Hawaiian Suns, this meal was so worth every penny (just bummed we passed on the Haupia cake that we had last time... Next time for sure cause that stuff is like legal crack), I'm positive we will be frequent offenders here!

And bonus thank you to the awesome "Auntie" for the extra musubis! Kids are so stoked!!! You guys are now their favorite, and ours as well!

I usually order the two meat dinner with chicken katsu and beef short ribs and it has always been really good. I haven't ordered from here in months!!! So I decided to order my fav two meat dinner again and I don't know what happened but it was TERRIBLE!!!! The chicken katsu was over cooked and burnt, there were chunks in my gravy, and the mac salad was inedible...the mac salad was watery!!!  Maybe they changed cooks or management, I don't know, but I will not come back here again if the food continues to be as terrible as it was this time!!!!!  So just beware before you order from this place.

This place is so good I usually get Kalbi Beef and Furikake Chicken with white rice and Mac salad sometimes I just get a green salad as my side and it is paired with a delicious sesame dressing that is my favorite! The food is always fresh and the service is on point. I usually order through yelp and my orders are correct and I never have any issues. This is in my opinion one of the best Hawaiian spots in Vegas.
If you want Hawaiian food in Las Vegas there only one place, island flavor. I drive 45 mins there jus to eat lol.

Pretty good Hawaiian food here. Service was prompt and friendly. The place is clean and the food is straight forward. I like the fact that they cook to order so the food is hot and fresh. I ordered the mix plate of Kalbi short ribs and furikake chicken. The Kalbi short ribs were tender and flavorful, but some of the ribs were more fat than meat. The furikake chicken are pieces of chicken deep fried in a sweet and savory sauce which was pretty tender and tasty. They also sell masubi, which are sushi rolled Spam. They masubi was really big, but since I ordered a lot of food I decided to try it next time. They were also selling a chantilly guava with huapia cake, which I asked about and the person said it was like a chocolate cake with a yellow something, they personally haven't tried it, but the worker said people like it. May I'll try it next time. Also,  I opted for sauteed veggies instead of the macoroni salad for my first try here. Unfortunately, the sauteed veggie butter sauce ended up leaking all over the bag inside. The rest of the food held up fine though. Food was good and service was friendly. Will give this place another try, but will double bag to-go orders just in case.

If you want a delicious, hearty meal that will more than fill you up, come to island flavor. Get yourself a mixed plate and try everything. Upgrade to their delicious fried rice with juicy pieces of pork in it. This time around I got furikake chicken which is sweet, crispy and has that touch of seaweed which is really good. My son is into short ribs right now so we got the kalbi as the second meat. Amazing. You get the meat options, fried rice, a little cabbage at the bottom, and their side of delicious Mac salad! The coworkers and I always hit up the Durango location, this one is identical. Other dishes I've tried are the chicken Katsu loco mojo and poke. When that gravy mixes with steamed rice something magical happens . Seriously go try it. Ask for some sriracha on the side and enjoy!

Yiiiiikes!!  I don't think we will be back here. Since the new owner took over , the prices went up ! A Kalbi / furikake chicken plate and a drink alone , cost my bf $21 !!! She seems greedy. Keep up with the prices I don't think this business will be getting the business they always had before.

As a college student, this place is value and delicious at its finest. For around $10 you have a delicious dinner and leftovers for lunch the next day. Definitely recommend the furikake chicken, fried rice, Kalbi ribs, and poke! Small place but fast service!

I love their original location and I'm so happy they have one closer to where I live...every item on the menu is good (& huge portions) so you can't go wrong no matter what you choose...my favorite is the furikake chicken and the furikake poke...

also thank you to the uncle who hooked us up with a free block of kulolo today   (they get fresh poi on Thursday's and fresh kulolo on Fridays)
Yummy  No BS Very Good Support Your Local Family Mom And Pop Restaurant Awesome  Service

You can never EVER go wrong with Hawaiian food that not only has great flavor, huge portion sizes and beautiful presentation. I ordered the Loco Moco this evening for dinner along with a Lilikoi Passion Hawaiian Sun and was in complete heaven. The restaurant was small but still very spacious, and very modern in design. If I could rate higher I would. I recommend any visitor or local in the area craving Hawaiian food, come to this place!
Great portions. Enough for two separate meals. Excellent service also. If you don't have room for dessert, don't let that stop ordering some to-go. You will be delighted.

Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  Seriously.  The food is amazing.  Ordered take out tonight for dinner.  Got two mix plates to share between my fianc and I.  Highly recommend these items.
1. Furikake Chicken - Freaking Delicious!!
2. Teriyaki Steak - Super Tender strips of steaks in Teriyaki Sauce
3. Roast Pig with Gravy - Super Super Tender chunks of Roast Pork in Gravy
4. Kalbi Ribs - Delicious 
5. Hawaiian style Poke

Their portions are out of control.  They give you a lot of food.  The flavors are soooo good. You won't be disappointed at all.

I love this company but I much prefer the Durango location. I know this is an Express location but sometimes you just want to sit down & eat. I feel like the furikake chicken at this location isn't as flavorful but it is still good. Not many seating options because of the small space. It is also very loud here with the kitchen being open. Customer service is decent but overall if you want to try Island Flavor go to the Durango location.
Best Hawaiian food in town!!!! Best Hawaiian food period!!! Everything delicious and great service

This place was fantastic. I will def be back! Got the Hawaiin poke the 1/2 size and it was actually a lot! Got the plate with Teri chicken and short ribs! Came with white rice but you have the option to substitute and got the macaroni salad!
What else can be said about this place that already hasn't been said.  Great food, good staff. Never a really long wait...

I'm not sure why this place is called Hawaiian because the food did not blow me away as far as something different in the US. The fried pork chop alone was flavorless and adding that brown gravy made it a little better but the gravy taste like those packets you can buy in Walmart. Nevertheless, the grill pork and fried chicken wings were a little better

The food is always 0n0
Nice Prices & Big portions
The Fresh Poke is my Favorite
Thank you Lo, today the poke was extra 0n0 & Spicy. Yummy in my Tummy

We love this place!

Fresh ahi poke with avacado! Chicken katsu! Kalbi! Mac salad! The works!!!

Attention all locals in Las Vegas stop by this place! You won't be disappointed!

Great Hawaiian Food!

Here are some of the highlights:

1. Large portions, food for the next meal...yeah!

2. Great taste- man, i have no idea of the sodium level I am at leaving, but who cares, this is local food at its best.

3.  Need I say more - Korean chicken, Spam Musubi, Saimin, Poke, Oxtail Soup ( at times), Kalbi Short Ribs, Furikake Chicken, Chicken Teriyaki and more.  The choices here are excellent.  I wish they had the saimin and oxtail all the time. 

4.  Service - This is more self serve, order and sit down, they will bring things out to you too.  Everyone is great and courteous.  Very efficient.

5.  The only issue.... - They are too small unlike their main store off Durango.  Sometimes it is too busy here.

I really like this place as a go to when I am hankering for some good ole homestyle food!

GK says check it out.

I love their food!! Honestly great place. Plenty of food. Fast!! And friendly service what more can you ask for!! TBH I come here all the time!! I personally like this spot the best for Hawaiian food!! Come in and try, but careful if you come with a big group not a large location it's the express version. Yes there is another one on Durango larger location too!!

First time trying this place. REALLY good! Was surprised by how fresh and different the chicken, steak, and even macaroni salad tasted when compared to other "cookie-cutter" Hawaiian food joints. Highly recommended. Ordered my food online at 9:30 and it was ready right at 10:00 when they opened (woke up with a huge craving for Hawaiian food! Lol)

Smaller than the other Island Flavor on the west side, but the food is just as good.  I went with the furikake chicken and the Korean chicken.  Really solid dishes.  The mini-mall is a little sketchy, but go here for the food.  Plenty of tables to eat here, but we got it to go.

This place has been a hit and miss lately with their food. We usually get their kalbi and some other type of entree. However 50% of the time we come their kalbi does not have any flavor. It's usually tastes like soy sauce and oil. When it is flavored right, this place has our favorite kalbi dish. Their portions are definitely big. Would love to come here more often if their food always tasted the same whenever we would come.

Finally they made a location closer. The other location is somewhere in the galaxy for us. We used to frequent the other location when we lived in Southern Highlands. If you're looking for quality Hawaiian food that's authentic this is bar none best in Vegas. Forget L&L forget Aloha Kitchen. Yah they're ok but they're not authentic like Island Flavor. When we're not at home in the 808 state, this is honestly the closest we can get to home. Some of our favorites are the roast pork the loco moco or they fried rice with Portuguese sausage. Everything here is good here and the portions are huge so come hungry. Staff is nice and always super friendly. 5 shakas for Island Flavor. Even more now they're closer! Yay!
Super yummy; good service not rushed. Huge portions. Will def come here again. Combo and katsubchicken are good

Island Flavor is just as ono as the one on Durango. Tasty food with big portions. My favorites are the furikake chicken and the loco moco. Sometimes they have on special oxtail soup. The meat is super tender and broth full of ginger. Great for rainy days or hangovers. The kalbi ribs are good, but not great. There's spam musubi at the register, perfect for a quick snack! Service is always good here. Interior is on the smaller side, but usually not an issue since I do mostly to-go orders.

*****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge*****
72/100

"Order for us and speak the funny way you Hawaii people do" says all my poker buds who have been to the islands.

"Funny way?  OK" my answer.

"May I help you" asks the cashier.

"Yes, and good afternoon.  May I please order..." wisea$$es.

The Hawaiian plate lunch.  Double carbs (two scoops rice, one scoop mac salad), loads of protein doused in gravy or coated in sticky, sweet teriyaki sauce.  2,000+ kcal, and two days of saturated fat.

I know I'm gonna catch heat from da bruddahs back home, but plate lunch here is better than almost any in Hawaii if you excuse the strange "mainland" menu items ie French fries or sauted veg sub for rice.

Eater Vegas calls it Hawaiian BBQ.  Deeply marinated untrimmed, fatty, shortribs in a soy, sugar, ginger concoction, grilled and served on the bone.   Sweet, juicy, fatty; the burnt bits adding character, pulling the uber flavorful membrane from the bone and chewing it like a dog chews a rawhide, an added bonus.

Their furikake chicken, deep fried nuggets of chicken, heavily coated in flour and doused in a sticky sweet teriyaki sauce with laver and sesame seeds good eats.  Some overcooked, dry and chewy (da sauce taste better on those), larger nuggets moist and juicy.

Solid loco moco and hamburger steak with pan gravy.  Good beef stew made with fatty chunks of well braised beef (not dry and stringy). Huge spam musubi.

Pass  on the katsu, poke (previously frozen fish), fried shrimp, and teriyaki chicken (doused in sauce after being cooked).

Friendly counter service.  Inexpensive with most plate lunches $9 - $10.

That's it.  Time fo grind!

Visiting from San Diego for my son's baseball tournament and I was in need of some local grinds cus I'm sick of burger and fries!  Stumbled upon this gem and let's just say we're going back for lunch again today! Mac salad, teri steak, teri chix, furikake chix, chix katsu and shoyu poke all on point!  Cashier was super nice as well!  The only "con" is their spot is too small with only four - four tops.  Won't stop us from going back though!  Take out is always an option!!

Meh its ok, not bad. The mixed plate is my go to and Ive been here a few times now. The flavors are decent, the Kalbi short ribs are tasty but very fatty, and the Hawaiian style pork comes with a gravy that reminded me of turkey gravy. In general the food is quite heavy and fatty, the mixed plate is almost enough for two meals. Unfortunately the food just isn't very high quality - there are much better Hawaiian options in town, such as Ross J.

When I'm missing home I go on the hunt for Hawaiian BBQ places and as always I expect them to taste just like home. During my first visit there was a long line so we waited in total after ordering for about 25 minutes. When I looked at the menu I felt like there wasn't as much variety, Im not sure if it is because this location is small but still I was expecting this place to have options. 

I ordered their teriyaki chicken plate and my fianc got the kalbi short ribs plate. We got a drink with or plates and the total was about $26/$28 with tax. I figured it is pricey but hopefully the portioning will make up for it. Unfortunately, it didn't. The food was good but the portioning was more on the small side. The portioning and the wait was an issue.

The best local food in Vegas most likely. They give big portions and super flavorful! Pick this spot over aloha kitchen if you're from Hawaii. Either way wherever you're from, pick this spot. I ordered the poke here and it was bomb. They also have amazing teriyaki chicken.

Though very solid and tasty island food, but it doesn't compare to my 808 joint.  The portions were huge and the plate I ordered could've feed 3 of us.  The fried rice was way better than a place that rhymes with "Handa Suppressed".   Good food and friendly service... would recommend a go to place if you're on that side of town!

This place is amazing, I wish I knew about it sooner, been hear 2 times in the past week and I must say I am hooked, quality of meat and flavor is top notch and they pack the foam containers to the max, also $2 spam masubi, I rarely do yelp reviews but I couldn't resist

The ahi here is absolutely amazing! It tastes so fresh and they give you a very generous amount. I've been here 4 times and the ahi is so good that I haven't gotten to try anything else, but from what I hear from friends who go there often, everything else is just as good. Restaurant quality without the long wait.

9/10 for hawaiian flavor, this place is the best I've tried so far. 5x better then L&L bbq and better then ono hawaiian bbq in LA. The Mix plate with kalbi and the fried chicken bites with glaze sauce, I forgot the name lol, but was excellent! I would definitely take the 12 min drive from the vegas strip to island flavor for Hawaiian food.

Big portions. Ono food.  Roast pork is tender.  Chicken wings just ok.  But always gotta support the locals up on the mainland so definitely go try em out and support the 808.  nothing better than local grinds
Go out of your way to get here..... i pick this place over everywhere else in the south valley they will take care of you homemade and fresh

Even better today, the customer service is so good today.  Friendly people just makes the meal so much better. 

We got the mix plate with kalbi and fruitcake chicken.  The kalbi was good but I think the marinade was not as favorable like the other location.  The furitake chicken was crispy and yummy yum yum.

Hands down, One of the BEST Hawaiian food in Las Vegas! It is an absolute MUST when I am the area. As I write this review, my mouth is watering just thinking about their food. 
 
I had the famous mixed plate with Kalbi Ribs & furikaki Chicken. Huge mouth watering portions. It took me 2 days to finish the combo plate. Also, you know when a Hawaiian food joint by the mac salad. It was so DELICIOUS!

Customer service was excellent. I felt I was served by a family member who really wanted me to enjoy my food experience.

Located in a strip mall, near a movie theater, behind the IHOP. There is plenty of parking.

I LOVE ISLAND FLAVOR!

I was craving poke for lunch and found this place on yelp. They serve different kinds of poke and the avocado one sounded the best to me. I was a little disappointed that they ran out of avocado for the day but they still offered it, and I had to pay full price for it without the avocado.  However, the poke itself was pretty good. You could tell it was fresh and the quality was excellent. I got the combo so it came with a Mac salad and rice. I love Mac salad but didn't enjoy theirs as much. There was a strong pepper taste. The place is pretty small, so if it's busy there may not be seats. The price was decent. Would probably come back when I'm craving poke and in the area again.

Back again. The place is slammed and the food with service is totally 5 star all the way. This IS the BEST Hawaiian food in Vegas, HANDS DOWN!!!  NO ONE is even close. They have daily specials as well, but do run out sometimes because it's FRESH!  So damn good!!!  Just like my friends in
Hawaii. Aloha. Mahalo. Enjoy!

I was so excited to try Hawaiian food. I ordered what I thought was a hamburger. What I got was white rice and some meat SWIMMING in a pool of gravy with an egg floating on top. There was more gravy than anything else, it actually made me sick.

Island Flavor was packed when I came for lunch on a weekday. It took a while to get our food (~20 min) for take out but at least it was fresh! I tried a Mixed Plate of Kalbi Ribs and Chicken Katsu and my boyfriend had the Furikake Chicken. The portions are hugeee! The plate comes with 2 scoops of rice and a side of maraconi salad. 

They gave me 6 Kalbi ribs for a mixed order which is great but the ribs themselves were very  thick, chewy and fatty ): I didn't like eating them too much. The Chicken Katsu was disappointing too since it wasn't very crispy. My boyfriend scored with his order though. The Furikake Chicken was seasoned perfectly and really does taste like furikake! The chicken was crispy and tender; I would definitely recommend this dish. The macaroni salad was delicious and one of our favorites as well.

I would give this place 3.5 stars, so a 4 rounding up. Although I was disappointed with the Kalbi and Chicken Katsu, the awesomeness of the Furikake Chicken made up for it. I recommend skipping the Kalbi and Katsu and trying something different!

This is one of those places that I've been going to for about 6 years but have never done a review for. It's probably because when I get my food I eat it so fast I forget to take pictures. 

This is the second of 2 locations. The other location is the larger restaurant with a full menu. This location is the smaller one with a condensed menu of some of the local favorites. Each day they have a list of specials that help expand their menu options. They also have a cooler with Hawaiian sun juices and some local desserts to complete your meal. 

Today we got the kalua pig with no cabbage, 1/2 order of ahi poke with avocado and mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and hamburger steak. 

Kalua pig comes with 2 scoops rice and Mac salad which taste great. They use corse ground pepper which makes it have a more peppery taste but I like it. The kalua pig is good. Not to salty, not to smoky, juuuuust right. 

The ahi poke is good and one of my wife's favorites. It has just enough sauce without drowning out the flavor of the fish. 

The mixed plate was great. It also comes with Mac salad and 2 scoops of rice. This is the first time I've had their Teri chicken and I must say that it was sooooo good. The marinade is on point and the grilled flavor kicks it up a notch. I will for sure order that again on its own. The hamburger steak was good. They have one of the best gravy around. 

If you go be prepared for friendly service and good food.
Great Hawaiian food! This place, hands down, puts out better quality/price/portioned food than any of similar restaurants around here. This is definitely going to be a regular spot for us!
Roast pork loco moco. Furikake shrimp. Poke. Kalua  Pig & Cabbage. Pulehu shortribs. Spam musubi. Leave in food coma.

GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE! My new fave Hawaiian spot. The poke is super fresh and perfectly seasoned. The kalbi had great flavor as well. The only thing I would say is there wasn't a thick enough piece in my spam musabi. There was a ton of rice and a very thin slice of spam. But regardless, it was good.

Definitely will come back and suggest it to others as well.

This is always one of my favorite spots to have some legit Hawaiian food.

The Teri beef is truly incomparable, it's thick cut, perfectly flavored, and hard to stop eating. 

The furikake chicken is not my favorite, it's well flavored but I'm not a huge fried food fan. It tastes great, but not my thing. 

The service is ALWAYS fantastic and I am truly a forever customer of this restaurant! Open up on the North side!!

Omg! I lurve this place!!!! Big portions, Awesome customer service, delicious Hawaiian local food!!! I can't get enough of this place! I'm just gonna keep this short and sweet, everyone should try Island Flavor Express... It's very addicting!!!
Great food and great price, the only thing is the waiting time. During lunch and dinner hours, they are extremely busy. Call in ahead to get your order and pick up for faster service :)
Good Hawaiin BBQ on the mainland. Really nice staff.

Was referred here due to just moving to the state from Hawaii and was really craving local food. I usually go to aloha specialties in California Hotel but after trying this place it is now my spot. The Kalua pig and roast pork are my favorites it's juicy and very tasty. I have tried aloha kitchen and they got nothing on Island Flavor. Best part the service here is super friendly and makes you get that Hawaiian feel greeted with a smile everyone talks and is there with a positive attitude love that keep up the good work!!!

The food is good the service sucks. Why even have a phone if you don't answer? And thank you for changing your steak it's awesome or I would never go back. the macaroni salad how ever is like they dumbed a whole bottle of black pepper in one little container.

Island flavor express just as good as the original island flavor! I love the Kalbi Ribs always my go to. If you think aloha kitchen and l&l is good wait till you try this place you'll never wanna get Hawaii food anywhere else! The service is good and the food is even better. Make sure to visit both locations.

You can not go wrong with delicious Hawaiian food that has great flavors and enormous portion sizes! This restaurant is located in a small plaza on Eastern and Pebble just across from the gas station. Compared to the bigger restaurant that's located on the southwest side of the valley, this Island Flavor is much small and can get packed very easily. 

I do both dine-in and takeout and they serve their food out just on time when you think about how big of a size & quality that they're giving. 
Their cashiers are very courteous and professional. And I love that good-vibe type of feel when you enter and leave the front door. 

Just a side note for those unaware of the changes, they have slightly increase some of their menu items and they have a note posted on their front store. Other than this slight downfall, they still continue to serve delicious food that me, my family, and friends crave for! 

When it comes to Hawaiian food overall, you can't beat this 'diamond in the rough' type of restaurant.
The bento box was really good. Excellent service! Clean dining room. The teriyaki chicken was the best!! I will be coming back here again.
really amazing loco moco. came here right after a road trip from california. everyone was super nice and gave off such family vibes. loved it

Love this place! Good food, huge portions served by friendly staff! Our favorite is the Furikake Chicken. We've also tried the Furikake Shrimp, but my husband and I think that the Furikake Chicken is better. Loco Moco, Kalbi beef and Macaroni were also good!

This is a great place to get flavorful and authentic local food. We came here after an appointment in the area because of the good reviews, and boy it did not disappoint. We both got combo plate with furikake chicken and teri beef (came with mac salad and rice). Let me just say that the portions are HUGE! We could have easily shared one combo since we both took more than half home!

We also ordered half pound of hawaiian style poke and it was so good and so fresh! The flavors were seriously amazing, we could not stop eating. I would be honestly come just for the poke! The seating area is small, so if it is busy I can't imagine there being much seating. My only negative is that it was fat the most expensive hawaiian food I've had out, but with the super huge portions and delicious flavor.. definitely worth it! I like to support small establishments like this because they truly work hard and take pride in what they do. Aside from the great food and friendly staff, I was digging the island tunes. 

I will definitely be back here again. I just hope they make another location some where northwest!

This place has item of your choice or you can make it a mixed plate which you can have two choices for $11.25 or if you like Kalbi add $1.00 more.
They have spam musubi everyday  Taro Brand Poi every Thursday and Kulolo every Friday.
Best island food in Vegas! We had furikake chicken, katsu, teri beef and avo bowl!! Yum!! Love the server/waitress/cashier. She was super friendly and full of smiles in a busy fast pace environment.

Oh how I miss Hawaii after coming here! If you're looking for good and cheap food, this is the place to be. We ordered a furikake chicken and that was more than enough for two people. We had a ton of leftover. The chicken has so much flavor! We also ordered a half order of avocado poke and it was just enough for me. The poke was good but didn't taste as fresh. Maybe I ordered the wrong flavor. I definitely want to try the shoyu or sesame poke next time. Anyways this place is delicious and gives huge portions so you can't go wrong with that.

portions are big ! each meat comes with 2 scoops of rice and a side so be careful not to over order. 

1.  Chicken Katsu $9 was average nothing amazing 

2.  furikake chicken $9.50 was probably their best item we tried it was fried perfectly and sort of sweet also 

3.  Kalbi short ribs $ 11.50 which tasted just like normal short ribs 

4.  Korean chicken $9 was not worth it and way too salthy.   avoid this item 

otherwise service was good not the fastest still takes about 15 minutes especially when it's busy.   other than a good pit stop prior to continuing your other part of the trip if your going east and avoiding the strip.
Best Hawaiian food in Vegas! The hardest part is trying to decide what to order because it's all delicious. Great service and sometimes they even have live music.
Doest look like much from the outside but the food was great! Poki, moco Loco and pork Loco were cooked perfect and had great flavor. I'll eat here every time I'm in town! Friendly service too!

This is my cheat meal to the max!  Salty, meaty and oh so good.  

The chicken furikake is battered, deep fried and then glazed in this teriyaki-like sauce.  The batter has a good crunch despite the glaze and it's an addictive dish.  Knowing it's deep fried, I tend to shy away from these types of food, but I can never come to Island Flavor and not order this dish.  

The pulehu ribs has a dry rub versus the kalbi ribs more of a saucy seasoning are both salted heavy.  I always have to order my dish light on the sauce and the chef is more than happy to obliged.  I get an option to have brown rice instead of white rice, and then I replace my mac salad with sauted vegetables.  This place offers a good medium for me.  Even though I'm having a cheat meal, I still get a dose of my healthier options.  

The kalua pig is smokey, light on the salt, and you can't go wrong with shredded pork. 

This is a definite must try if you're craving Hawaiian flavors for plate lunch style.  It's on top of my list of restaurant to eat while in the city of Henderson.  I'm hooked and have cravings that knows no bounds.   

They close early on Sundays at 4p.m., so don't come late and disappoint yourself, like many before.

I enjoyed my kimchi with rice. Daughter though her musubi had too much rice. Husband thought his loco moco had too much rice and not enough gravy on the meat. Little kid thought her saimin was good, she's 3. It's a small little restaurant with about 5 high top tables that seat 4. There is another regular table close to back that seats 4. Service was fairly fast. I would go back. 
This was on a Sunday around 11:30am.

Huge portions and great service is found at Island Flavor express. Stopped in last night to grab some dinner to go. It was my first time here but thanks to the many Yelp reviews I already knew I wanted to try the furikake chicken and kalbi ribs. 

There was no wait and we were greeted as we walked in. It took about 10 minutes and our order was ready. Just picking up the bag I could tell there was a lot of food in there. When I got home I couldn't  believe the portion size. Definitely enough for lunch the next day and I am not a small eater! 

The furikake chicken was really good, cooked well and I liked the flavor of it. The kalbi ribs were hit and miss. The flavor was great with lots of nice crispy pieces. However they were really fatty and quite thick cut. The kalbi I am used to are much thinner. The two scoops of rice and mac salad were also good to complete the mixed plate. 

Glad I stopped in to try them out. Would definitely stop in again if in the area.

I am so behind the curve when it comes to dining spots east of the 15. Even my long time Yelp buddy Rod from Hawaii knows about this place, dine here with his poker buds and written a review nearly a year ago.

Sad face!!!

So, I spent a good chunk of today on Yelp researching for places to eat, those that may offer lunch or dinner or daily specials, as well as those that are closed on Mondays. Yeah, I am not afraid to admit I research potential places I might eat at the way some people research and plan their European vacation. But with the WiFi sporadically cutting in and out, which the Cox technician blames on the 2 year old Netgear router, this impromptu query took longer than expected. By the time I narrowed down my list and picked a spot I was already very hungry and is way past the time for a Hobbit's second lunch.

Luckily, Island Flavor Express was just a few minutes drive on surface street without too much traffic.  Finding a parking space was also not that difficult, although I did have to drive to the side of the building to locate a vacant parking spot that is not designated as short term 30 minutes parking.

Upon walking in, I saw their Today's Special and after a quick glance I opted to ordered their Kimchi Fried Rice with Korean Chicken Wings, instead of the Furikake Chicken that helped secured my decision to come here today in the first place.  Yeah, when it comes to food I am fickle like that.  None of that boring 60's diner conversation that either starts or ends with "have the usual" for me.

So after a few minutes the lady that took my order dropped off a to go box filled with my Kimchi Fried Rice surrounded my a mob of Korean Chicken Wings (the container was closed). Even without picking it up, I can tell/edumaguess that it was going to be substantial from the soft thud that it made when it made contact with the surface of the table. But I could totally have hallucinated it as a result of the low blood sugar level.  But picking it up only confirmed my 6th sense was not off at all.  How about that :)

The Kimchi Fried Rice also contains pieces of chasu, not just kimchi as one would suspect. It is decent, not the best I've had, but the portion is definitely on the high end of the spectrum for serving size.  The Korean Chicken Wings are cooked nicely, but is not sticky like the ones served at Korean Fried Chicken spots around town. But after awhile the whole meal elevates your sodium level, and as much as I love Hawaiian Sun products with Island grub, a single can is not enough. So plan ahead, buy 2 cans at $1.25 each or get soda from the fountain or water.

I'd totally be back again, hopefully for the Furikake Chicken, in the not too distant future.

Price: 4-5/5. very reasonable for the portions you get.

Parking: 4-5/5. plenty, just might have to walk a bit if the spaces directly out front are not available.

Tastes: 4/5. Nothing fancy, but pretty good and worth coming back for more.
Love this place! Employees are the best! The gal behind the register is always so nice and has a smile on her face regardless how busy she is! The food is as great as the people that work here!
